Olga is 38 years old and single.  She lives with her sister in a suburban neighborhood in San Pedro Sula.  She worked for a private company for many years.  Later on she was left without a job.  However, a year ago she decided to establish her own business of selling food, candy, and soft drinks.  She has her business set up in the center of the city.  She offers her customers buffet style breakfasts and lunches.

She will use the 10,000 lempira loan she is requesting to buy the supplies she needs every day to make the food.  She will buy things like meat, flour, shortening, condiments, vegetables, soft drinks, and rice, etc.  Her plan is to grow in the business and to, in the future, open another eatery in order to get more income.

loans.use: to buy supplies like meat, flour, shortening, condiments, vegetables, soft drinks, and rice, etc. in order to make food.

loans.name: Ma. Gina

texts.en:
Ma. Gina is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of five children in Talibon, Bohol. She has been running a sari-sari or variety store business for more than nine years now. She sells various goods and items to the people in her place. 

Ma. Gina needs a loan for the expansion of her business. With this intent, she joined CEVI to apply for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, rice, corn grits, sodas and other  beverages, soap and toiletries, etc. With this, she will be able to attract and cater for more customers in her store.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, rice, corn grits, sodas and other beverages, soap and toiletries, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a single woman, aged 61 years now. She is still in poultry keeping in Kiambu, and she has been doing this for the past three years. She earns a monthly income of KES 28,000 from the sale of poultry.

This will be Elizabeth’s second loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy chicks to rear, and chicken feed. She wants to be a more successful business woman in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years.

Myrna requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items for inventory, like snack foods, canned goods and other groceries.

In the future, Myrna would like to save enough to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items for inventory, like snack foods, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Maritza Felicia

texts.es: Maritza vive en las orquídeas. Tiene 33 años. Es viuda y tiene dos hijos. Ella a raíz de su viudez ella tomo  la decisión de buscar trabajo para seguir  adelante con los estudios de sus hijos. Como nadie le daba la oportunidad de trabajar en una empresa. Ella  decide juntar dinero que tenia  para dar apertura  a su negocio de venta de ropa  En la actualidad sus  ventas poco a poco creció  hasta llegar a tener  clientela  necesaria  Maritza  trabaja diariamente sola. Ella  trabaja  desde la mañana  .Con el préstamo  el  comprara ropa, arreglos,  varios, etc. su meta es poder terminar su casa que su negocio  sea más grande.
texts.en: Maritza lives in Las Orquídeas.  She’s 33-years-old and has two children.  Due to her widowhood she decided to seek work to continue with her children’s schooling.  Since no one would hire her to work in a firm, she decided to use her savings to open a clothing business.  Her sales have gradually grown and now she has the required clientele.  Maritza works by herself every day starting very early.  She will use the loan to buy clothes and various merchandise.  Her goal is to be able to finish her house and that her business is larger.

loans.use: to buy clothes and assorted merchandise.

loans.name: Jessica Virginia

texts.es: Jessica vive en las orquídeas. Tiene 33 años. Es soltera y tiene tres  hijos. Ella a raíz de su separación de su ex pareja  ella tomo  la decisión de buscar trabajo para seguir  adelante con los estudios de sus hijos. Como nadie le daba la oportunidad de trabajar en una empresa. Ella  decide juntar dinero que tenia  para dar apertura  a su negocio de venta de cosméticos  En la actualidad sus  ventas poco a poco  han ido creciendo  hasta llegar a tener  clientela  necesaria  Jessica  trabaja diariamente sola. Ella  trabaja  desde la mañana en diferentes  horarios .Con el préstamo  el  comprara , ropa ,cosméticos ,  varios, etc. su meta es poder  terminar su casa .
texts.en: Jessica lives in Las Orquídeas.  She’s 33-years-old, single and has three children.  As a result of her separation from her ex-spouse she decided to seek employment to continue forward with her children’s education.  Since no one would hire her to work in a firm, she decided to use the money she had to open a business selling cosmetics.  Her sales have been growing gradually until she had the required clientele.  Jessica works by herself every day.  She starts early in the morning with various schedules.  She will use the loan to buy clothes, cosmetics, assorted merchandise, etc.  Her goal is to finish her house.

loans.use: to buy clothes, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Mkamba

texts.en:
Mkamba is a 60-year-old married man. He has two children, ages 27 and 34 years. He describes himself to be a goal-oriented man. 

Mkamba operates a farm where he sells farm products. He has been involved in this business for thirty years and employs five staff members. His business is located at an agricultural area, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a poor road network. 

Mkamba will use the KES 8,700 loan to buy a water tank that will be used by his family members. 

His business goal is to improve his business within five years. Mkamba hopes that in the future, he will expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a 53-year-old married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 7 years to 28 years. She describes herself to be a focused and determined woman. 

Rehema operates a farm where she sells maize, beans, peas, etc. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located at an agricultural area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Rehema will use the KES 11,100 loan to buy a water tank that will be used by her family members for household chores. This is her seventh loan with SMEP DTM after taking a previous loan of KES 100,000, which she managed to pay successfully.

Her business goal is to buy land so as to increase her farming business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have diversified her business into livestock farming.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
El comité San Roque es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, tiene 11 miembros, donde toda trabajan y se esfuerzan al máximo para poder ir creciendo en el emprendimiento de cada una.
Epifania es una de estas mujeres, ella trabaja de limpiadora y también en su casa se dedica a la cría y venta de animales de corral. Con estos trabajos ayuda a su familia, y tiene todo lo que necesita. Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante y ser mejor cada día.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales, y de esta forma poder  seguir criando y alimentando a sus animales.
texts.en:
The San Roque communal bank is located in the city of Curuguaty.  It has 11 members, all of whom work and put forth maximum effort in order to be able to grow in each of their endeavors.

Epifania is one of these women.  She works as a cleaner.  She also raises and sells farmyard animals at her house.  It is with these jobs that she helps her family and has everything she needs.  She is a person with a great desire to get ahead and to improve each day.

She is requesting a loan to buy balanced feed for her animals.  This way she will be able to continue raising and feeding her animals.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is still in her retail business selling charcoal, a business that has enabled her not only to gain much experience but also to move her family forward. She is a dedicated woman with very many goals to achieve. She struggles to ensure that she reaches success. 

Dama says that since she invested her previous loan, her business has been growing and today she counts on a good number of clients and an improved income. Dama needs to stock her store with more merchandise but she lacks enough working capital. It is this sole reason that made Dama request a new loan.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
Sarah's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Sarah is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo, in the Mubende region of Uganda. For the past year, Sarah has been working hard to manage her small business; she sells clothes. 

To help her expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her young siblings. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to give a better education to her young siblings. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is 33 years old and married, with four children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rona is borrowing PHP 13,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rona has been raising pigs for four years and also earns additional income from fish-vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is married and has 11 children. She has received no formal education. Ama sells palm oil in Bremawg, near Abura, and has done so for sometime now. Her husband is a farmer. Ama uses her income to support her husband with their large family’s expenses. 

Ama will use the loan to purchase more palm fruits for the making of palm oil, a staple ingredient in Ghana. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to grow her business and be able to save more to secure her enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruits for the making of palm oil, a staple ingredient in Ghana.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick  is a 50-year-old, married man. He has five children, with ages ranging from 6 years to 20 years. He describes himself to be a warm and caring man. He operates a retail store where he sells iron sheets, timber, and cement. He has been involved in this business for three years and employs two staff members. His business is located near a busy, popular hotel and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high prices of cement and timber. 

He will use the KES 11,100 loan to buy a water tank that will be used by his family members. His business goal is to run a well-stocked hardware store within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will have expanded his business.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to be used by his family.

loans.name: Jumanne

texts.en:
Jumanne is a 52-year-old married man. He has seven children with ages ranging from 3 years to 28 years. He describes himself to be a focused man. He operates a water retail business where he sells water to the community. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located at a very productive area and his primary customers are local residents. 

Jumanne describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate storage facility of water for selling. He will use the Kes 32,700 loan to buy a water tank that will be used for storing water for selling to the community. His business goal is to improve his business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business by having at least three more water retail business outlets.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 57 years old, married, and has eight children.  One of them is in school.

Victoria is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Victoria requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Victoria has been raising pigs for 10 years, and she has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Victoria would like to save money in the future, to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya, which is a popular banana growing region. He has two children. Benard has been farming for 10 years.  His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, crops, and a salary from a job.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "It gives me profit that helps me to meet my needs." His biggest challenge is: "Lack of markets for our produce." Animals on the farm have been given the names of Sandimu and Nyasero. 

Benard will use the loan to construct a dairy housing unit for his animals. Benard was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "Easy rules both before and after the loan."  This client was also asked what he had learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, and he said, "This loans helps improve our living standard."

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked how this loan would benefit his family, Benard replied, "It will help me purchase another dairy cow, hence improving our lives."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Benard owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile.' Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, TV' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, DVD.'

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To construct a dairy unit for his cows.

loans.name: Nazi

texts.en:
Nazi lives in the Kobuleti District. She is 64 years old and lives with her husband, grown son, daughter-in-law, and three grandchildren. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have three calves and a milk cow whose milk is used in cheese products. In addition, Nazi owns a cornfield and a plot of land where nuts are grown. The harvested products are sold at the local open market. Nazi and her husband are provided with a retirement pension. 

Several times, Nazi has requested loans from local credit providers, but her loan requests are always rejected because of the lack of experience in new business. Her current loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low incomes. 

With the received credit, Nazi will start up a fast-food café.  She will sell sandwiches, pies, and fizzy drinks. Nazi hopes her business will be profitable and that she will attract many customers since there is no similar café nearby. The profit will be reinvested in the same business and Nazi will be able to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to start up a fast-food cafe.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama, 46 years old, earns her living selling Mnazi (a local brew). She lives in the suburban area of Kisauni, Mombasa.

Dama is very anxious to get ahead. She wants to be a great micro-businesswoman. Thanks to her small business, Dama is bringing in more income and helping out the family. She has a large clientele, and through her work she'll manage to improve her house and help her husband with the income. Dama needs this loan to buy gallons of mnazi to sell.

loans.use: to buy gallons of mnazi to sell.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 43 years old, married, and has four children. Three of her children are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Vivian runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery products to sell. She has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items, such as sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

Vivian would like to save money to expand her business, and continue to send her children to college, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products to resell in her store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 50-year-old married woman supporting her two children, both aged 18 years old.  She has been selling fresh milk door-to-door in Kapsabet for six years, earning an income of KES 25,000.

For her seventh loan, Mary has borrowed KES 75,000 from KADET LTD. She has repaid her previous loan successfully and intends to use this one to pay her milk suppliers. Mary will use any profits she earns to pay school fees for her children and to improve her family's living standards. Her dream is to ensure her children have a good future.

loans.use: To pay her milk suppliers

loans.name: Lorena  Alba

texts.es: Alba  vive en las orquídeas. Tiene 31 años. Es soltera y tiene cuatro   hijos menores de edad. Ella a raíz de su separación de su ex pareja  ella tomo  la decisión de buscar trabajo para seguir  adelante con los estudios de sus hijos. Como nadie le daba la oportunidad de trabajar en una empresa. Ella  decide juntar dinero que tenia  para dar apertura  a su negocio de comida rápida En la actualidad su negocio  poco a poco  han ido creciendo  hasta llegar a tener  clientela  necesaria  alba trabaja diariamente desde la mañana  hasta la noche. Con el préstamo  el  comprara, Legumbres, carnes, granos, etc. su meta es  seguir trabajando en su propio negocio.
texts.en: Alba lives in the Las Orquídeas. She is 31 years old. She is single and has four dependent children.  Upon separating from her ex-partner, she made the decision to seek work to further her children’s studies. Since no one gave her the opportunity to work in a business, she decided to save up her money to open a fast food business.  Her business has been growing little by little to the point where she now has regular customers.  Alba works daily from morning until night.  With the loan, she will buy vegetables, meat, and grains.  Her goal is to continue working in her own business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat and grains.

loans.name: Edison Gonzalo

texts.es: Edison  vive en las orquídeas. Tiene 34 años. Es soltero y no  tiene hijos. El tomo  la decisión de buscar trabajo para seguir  adelante con los estudios. Como nadie le daba la oportunidad de trabajar en una empresa. El  decide juntar dinero que tenia  para dar apertura  a su negocio es ebanistería En la actualidad su negocio  poco a poco  han ido creciendo  hasta llegar a tener  clientela  necesaria  Edison  trabaja diariamente   desde la mañana  . Con el préstamo  el  comprara, tablas, caña, pintura,  varios, etc. su meta es  seguir trabajando y mejorar su taller y la casa de sus padres.
texts.en:
Edison lives in Las Orquídeas (a suburb of Guayaquil, Ecuador). He is 34 years old, single, and doesn’t have any children. He decided to look for a job as he wanted to continue with his studies. As no one would take him on to work in a business, he decided to gather the money he had and use it to open his own woodworking business. 

The business has been growing gradually and he now has a regular clientele. He works every day starting in the morning. With the loan he plans to buy boards, canes, paint etc. His goal is to continue with the business, and make improvements to his workshop and his parents’ house.

loans.use: buy boards, canes, paint etc.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa is a widow and has three children. She has received no formal education. Yaa sells provisions in Bremawg, near Abura, and has done so for some time, now. She uses her income to support her children. 

Yaa will use the loan to buy more provisions, increasing the quantity and variety of the inventory for sale at her store. With the new profits from her expanded business, Yaa plans to increase her capital base so she will be able to buy more provisions for sale in the future.

loans.use: to buy more provisions, increasing the quantity and variety of the inventory for sale at her store.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine, 37 years old, is married and has 6 children. She describes herself as an ambitious woman. Irine operates a farm where she sells farm products such as cereals, etc. She has been involved in this business for 10 years and employs 3 staff members. Her business is located in a very productive area and her primary customers are traders from the nearby market. She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor road networks.

Irine will use this KES 11,100 loan to buy a water tank to be used by her family members. Her business goal is to improve her farming by using modern agricultural technology within 5 years. Irine hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 26 years old, single, and supports no one. He owns a retail shop selling essential goods in Kapsabet and has been in the business for a period of one year, earning a monthly income of KES. 5,000.

He is servicing his second loan from KADET LTD of KES. 40,000 and he intends to use this amount to purchase washing detergents, sugar, rice, cooking fat and tea leaves for resale.

The anticipated profit will be used to purchase a motorbike to enable him to start a transportation business. His dream is to be successful in his business and live happily.

loans.use: To purchase  more stock of washing detergents, sugar, rice, cooking fat and tea leaves for resale.

loans.name: Violet's Group

texts.en:
Violet's group is comprised of three hard-working women. Violet is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. For the past two years, Violet has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, soap, milk and bread. 

To help expand her business, Violet has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential goods like milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale, and will help Violet to generate greater profits and pay for her own school fees. Violet hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Violet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more essential goods like milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a bongo.

loans.name: Virgen De Lourdes Group

texts.es:
El comité  Virgen de Lourdes, se conformo con la iniciativa de la señora Bernardina que se mostró muy interesada por el programa. Este comité se encuentra en el primer ciclo, y están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas.
La totalidad de este grupo está emprendiendo en la cría y venta de animales de corral, como ser gallinas, patos, cerdos, cabras y demás. Es un trabajo muy sacrificado, pero lo hacen para poder ayudar a sus familias.
Saturnina, una de las integrantes, solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de alimentos para sus animales, ya que quiere seguir cuidándolos bien y venderlos.
texts.en:
The group "Virgen de Lourdes" was formed because of Mrs. Bernardina, who became interested in the program. This group is in its first cycle and its members are learning to work together.

All this group’s members raise and sell farm animals, like hens, ducks, pigs and goats. It is a demanding job, but they do it in order to be able to help their families.

Saturnina, one of the group’s members, is requesting this loan to invest in feed for her animals. She wants to continue taking good care of them and then sell them.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema is taking out a new loan to expand her existing business, selling local brew. In addition to this business, thanks to her effort and the previous loan, she was able to start another business selling fried potatoes. She says that both businesses are doing well and her desire is to see herself have a prosperous future. Rehema is asking for this loan to buy gallons of local brew and at the same time buy sacks of raw potatoes for sale.

loans.use: to buy gallons of local brew and at the same time buy sacks of raw potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Adjao

texts.en:
Adjao sells 'banku', a local favorite food made of ground corn and cassava. Adjao sells banku in Bremawg near Abura, where she lives with her husband and four children.  Her husband is a farmer. 

Adjao has received no formal education.  However, she has been preparing banku for sale for some time now. She is responsible for helping her husband with their family expenses. Her loan will be used to buy to by more corn and cassava to prepare banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to improve and expand her banku-making trade.

loans.use: to buy more corn and cassava to prepare 'banku' for sale.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is married and has six children. Her husband is a farmer. Aba has no formal education. She sells doughnuts in Bremawg near Abura, which she has done for several years now. 

Aba uses her income to help her husband with the general upkeep of their family. Aba will use the loan to buy more flour, sugar and other necessary ingredients to make doughnuts for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to invest money back into her doughnut making business, to expand and meet the community’s demand for her tasty treats.

loans.use: to buy more flour, sugar and other necessary ingredients to make doughnuts for sale.

loans.name: Nvard

texts.en:
Nvard lives in Ararat village, with her husband and two children. Nvard owns agricultural land, where she grows apple, plum and apricot trees, and cultivates wheat. She works hard to gather a good harvest and have high income. But, unfortunately, the monthly income is hardly enough to cover her family's basic costs and sustain it. So Nvard has applied for this loan, to purchase wheat seeds and cover cultivation costs, to grow more wheat. This will significantly help Nvard to increase her income.

The loan is very important for Nvard to be able to ensure a better life for her family.

loans.use: to pay for wheat seeds and cover cultivation costs, which will enable her to grow more wheat and obtain more income.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa is single and has no children. She has received no formal education. She sells wakye in Bremawg, near Abura, which she has done for several years.

Wakye is a traditional rice dish in Ghana, made of rice, beans and red leaves; it is normally eaten with a spicy tomato salad, fish, or macaroni pasta. 

Yaa uses her income to support herself and take care of her personal expenses. Yaa will use the loan to purchase more beans, rice and red leaves to use in preparing wakye to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Yaa plans to further expand her wakye making trade.

loans.use: to purchase more beans, rice and red leaves to use in preparing the local dish, wakye.

loans.name: Lorena Marianela

texts.es: Lorena  vive en las orquídeas. Tiene 37 años. Es viuda y tiene tres hijos menores de edad. Ella a raíz de su viudez tomo  la decisión de buscar trabajo para seguir  adelante con los estudios de sus hijos. Como nadie le daba la oportunidad de trabajar en una empresa. Ella  decide juntar dinero que tenia  para dar apertura  a su negocio es tienda En la actualidad su negocio  poco a poco  han ido creciendo  hasta llegar a tener  clientela  necesaria  Lorena  trabaja diariamente   desde la mañana  . Con el préstamo  el  comprara, colas, lechugas,  varios, etc. su meta es  seguir trabajando y mejorar su casa
texts.en: Lorena lives in Las Orquídeas (The Orchids). She is 37 years old. She is a widow and has three grown children. As a result of becoming a widow, she decided to look for work so that she could continue paying for the education of her children. Since she was not offered work by any of the businesses where she looked, she decided to save up money to be able to open her own small store. Her business has grown little by little and now has the necessary clientele. Lorena works everyday, starting in the morning. She will use the loan to buy sodas, lettuce and other things. Her goals are to continue working and to make improvements on her home.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, lettuce and other things.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El. Sr. Juan es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, es soltero, y tiene como profesión la  mecánica de automóviles liviano, hace mas de 15 años que se dedica a esto, y gracias al buen trabajo que hace ya tiene una clientela bien definida que siempre acude a él.
Su deseo es poder seguir trabajando y el día de mañana ir agrandando su negocio para tener una mayor capacidad para recibir a más autos y tener mayores ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
Solicita su primer crédito que quiere destinar a la compra de un equipo de soldar que le será de extrema utilidad en su labor y que le ayudará a tener mayores clientes.
texts.en:
Juan is from the city of Curuguaty and is single.  He works as an auto mechanic and has more than 15 years in this profession.  Thanks to the high-quality work he does, he has built up a solid base of clients who always come to him.

He wants to be able to continue working and expand his business so that he will have the capacity to repair more vehicles and thus increase his income so he can help his family.

He is seeking his first loan, which he wishes to use to buy soldering equipment.  This will be extremely useful in his work and will allow him to gain more clients.

loans.use: to buy soldering equipment for his auto shop.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité  “Mujeres Emprendedoras” está en su primer ciclo y están aprendiendo el valor de trabajar en equipo y ayudarse las unas a las otras. Una de estas mujeres es Soraida, quien tiene una modesta, pero bien surtida despensa, que con el correr de los años quiere agrandar y tener una grande.
Su sueño es poder seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia como lo viene haciendo. Es por eso que solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de carne, embutidos, verduras, leches y demás insumos para poder tener bien surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
The committee “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Entrepreneurial Women) is in its first cycle and the members are experiencing the value of working as a team and helping each other. One of these women is Soraida, who owns a small but well stocked shop, which she would like to grow over the years and turn into a big one.
Her aspiration is to be able to carry on working and helping her family, as she has been doing until now. It is for this reason that she is applying for this loan, in order to invest it in the purchase of meat, sausages, vegetables, milk and other basic foods, so that her business may have a good assortment of products.

loans.use: to buy meat, sausages, vegetables, milk etc.

loans.name: Adjao

texts.en:
Adjao sells rice in Bremawg, near Abura. Adjao has received no formal education. She is single and has no children. 

Adjao has been selling rice for many years. She is responsible for supporting herself and taking care of her personal expenses. Her loan will be used to buy a larger quantity of rice for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business, part to save, and part to invest back into her business.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of rice for resale.

loans.name: Angel Javier

texts.es:
Angel es un joven de 20 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Santiago, el cual se caracteriza por su clima cálido además de desarrollarse la agricultura en especial se cultiva el algodón, la uva, el esparrago, entre otros. Desde pequeño aprendió a trabajar, ya que debido a que sus padres tienen pocos recursos económicos, tenía que trabajar para poder apoyarlos; pero a pesar de las adversidades a logrado salir adelante, tal es así que se encuentra  estudiando en un instituto de Música de su ciudad, ya que a el le encanta Tocar guitarra y es por ello que pone mucho empeño para seguir estudiando lo que más le gusta.

Para poder solventar los gastos de sus estudios, Angel trabaja como obrero en un fundo de su ciudad, el labora alrededor de 8 horas al día y el cree que esta saliendo adelante porque le pone mucho empeño y responsabilidad.

Angel está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá pagar la matrícula y adquirir algunos materiales como pergaminos, cuadernos pentagramáticos, instrumentos, entre otros, asi el podrá tener los materiales necesarios para estudiar poder luchar por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su propia Orquesta y ser un gran músico
texts.en:
Angel is a 20 year old young man who lives in the Santiago district, which is known for its warm climate as well as being agriculturally well developed, particularly in cotton, grapes, asparagus, and others. Since he was a small boy he learned to work, since his parents were of little economic resources and he had to work to support them. Despite the adversities that he has faced he has succeeded in getting ahead. He currently is studying in a music institute in his city, since he likes playing the guitar and this is why he is dedicating the time to continue study. 

To be able to support his study expenses, Angel works as a laborer on an estate in his city. He works around 8 hours per day and he thinks that he is getting ahead because he dedicates a lot of effort and responsibility. 

Angel is very appreciative to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he can pay his university fees and adquire some parchment paper, notebooks, and instruments to be able to continue studying and in this way be able to realize his biggest dream: to have his own orchestra and be a great musician.

loans.use: to pay for tuition and buy school supplies.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel es un joven de 20 años de edad cuya vivienda se encuentra en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad con un clima muy cálido y con atractivos turísticos muy hermosos. Miguel es padre de un pequeño de 2 años y junto con su pareja se esfuerzan mucho para poder brindarle a su hijo una buena calidad de vida y sobre todo mucho amor. 

Dia a día Miguel trabaja como jardinero en una empresa agrícola de la zona, el labora alrededor de 9 horas al día y cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo realiza su trabajo con mucho cuidado y honradez.

Miguel está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras en la, ya que realizara el mejoramiento de tuberías de agua y de esta manera poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 20 year old young man who's home is located in the city of Chincha. Chincha is a city with a very hot climate and with very beautiful tourist spots. Miguel has a 2 year old son; along with his partner he works hard to be able to provide for their son a good quality of life and above all, full of love.

Day to day Miguel works as a gardener in an agricultural business in the area. He works around 9 hours a day and believes that he does well in his work because he is very responsible and above all because he does his work with much care and honor.

Miguel is very thankful to the Kiva lenders, because of the help they provide he will be able to make improvements to his house, like improving the water pipes. This will also improve the quality of life of his family. He will continue working towards accomplishing his biggest dream, "to give a good education to his son."

loans.use: to improve his home

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena sells doughnuts in Bremawg near Abura. Abena has received no formal education. She is divorced and has four children. Abena has been selling doughnuts for some time now. She is responsible for paying her children’s school fees and supporting her family alone. Her loan will be used to buy more flour, sugar and other necessary ingredients to make doughnuts to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow and improve her doughnut-making activities.

loans.use: to buy more flour, sugar and other necessary ingredients to make doughnuts to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María de 60 años, viuda y con 1 hijo cuya misión de convertirlo en un joven de trabajo y responsabilidad se hicieron posibles gracias a su constancia.
Es propietaria de una vivienda construida a base de ladrillos y concreto.
Trabajadora y con amplio espíritu  de progreso se dedicó a diversas actividades de las cuales la mas rentable hallada fue el negocio de la  juguería y fuente de soda. Lleva casi 7 años desempeñándolo en el primer piso de su vivienda con el apoyo de su sobrina en donde ofrece diversa variedad de jugos preparados con fruta de la zona como la papaya, naranja entre otros acompañándolo de otros como su popular keke de piña muy popular en su barrio.
Le agrada su negocio puesto que es algo sencillo y el detalle es lo que cuenta en cuando a la calidad de  servicio es brindado  a sus clientes.
La mejor manera de generar ingresos mensuales es la pensión de jugos que brinda a sus clientes quienes prefieren como primera comida del día alimentos preparados a base de frutas.
A manera de financiar los insumos que requiere para desempeñar su negocio debe contar con capital de respaldo  motivo por el cual acude a su institución financiera.
Sus planes a futuro apuntan a la mejora de su vivienda con un segundo piso adicional y mejorar su negocio.
Requiere contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para invertirlos en su negocio y comprar insumos como frutas y demás insumos para la preparación de sus pasteles.
texts.en: María is a 60-year-old widow with one son. Through her constant efforts she has been successful in her mission to raise him to be a hardworking and responsible young man. She owns a home that is built of bricks and concrete. Working hard, and with a great deal of motivation to make progress, she has been involved in many business activities. She has found that the most profitable activity is her business selling juices and sodas. For the last seven years, she has run this business on the first floor of her home with the support of her niece. She offers a wide variety of juices prepared from local fruits, such as papaya and oranges, as well as other items such as her pineapple cake, which is very popular in her neighborhood. She is grateful to have her business, since it is something simple, and the details are what counts. The quality of her service is what brings in her customers. Her most important source of monthly income is from the sale of juices, as her customers prefer to eat or drink something made from fruit as the first meal of the day. In order to buy the supplies she needs, she requires financial backing; thus she goes to her financial institution for support. Her future plans include adding another floor to her some and improving her business. She requires a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to invest in her business and buy supplies such as fruit and other items needed to make her cakes.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fruit and other ingredients to make her cakes.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
La Sra. Mariela es una mujer humilde, Mariela es de un pueblo llamado Huambalo situado en la ciudad de Ambato, Mariela es madre soltera ella tiene 2 hijos de una niña de 3 años y un niño de 6 años a quien ama con todo su corazón y lucha día a día por sacarlos adelante. Mariela se define como una persona muy trabajadora, responsable y con infinito amor hacia su familia y sus semejantes.
Mariela solicita el presente crédito a FODEMI para invertir en la compra de semilla de cebolla de buena calidad para mejorar su producción y en el mejoramiento y tratamiento del terreno con la compra de abonos, para cuidarlo y darle mantenimiento para la próxima siembra.
El sueño que Mariela tiene es llegar a ser un productor de cebolla muy importante, tener un terreno grande donde pueda sembrar y cosechar diferentes hortalizas, y con estos ingresos darles a sus hijos la educación que ellos se merecen.
texts.en:
Mariela is a humble woman from a town named Huambalo, located in the city of Ambato.  Mariela is a single mother; she has two children--a 3 year old daughter and a 6 year old son--whom she loves with all of her heart and she strives day after day to help them succeed.  Mariela is characterized as a hard-working and responsible person with an infinite love for her family and her neighbors.  

Mariela is requesting this loan from FODEMI to invest in the purchase of good quality onion seeds to improve her production as well as in the improvement and treatment of her field through the purchase of compost and fertilizers, to give them the maintenance they need for the next planting.  Mariela's dream is to become an important onion producer, to have a large field where she can plant and harvest different crops, and with this income, provide her children with the education they deserve.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of good quality onion seeds to improve her production as well as in the improvement and treatment of her field through the purchase of compost and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua sells banku, a local dish made of corn and cassava dough, in Bremawg, near Abura. Ekua has received no formal education. She is married and has six children. Her husband is a farmer in the area. 

Ekua has been selling banku for many years. She is responsible for helping her husband to feed and clothe their children, and pay their school fees. Ekua will use her loan to buy to buy more corn and cassava, to use in preparing banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to improve and expand her banku making venture.

loans.use: to buy more corn and cassava, to use in preparing banku for sale.

loans.name: Guillermo Enrique

texts.es:
Guillermo es un hombre trabajador y con un carisma contagiante, vive en la ciudad de Ica, la cual s ecaracteriza por su clima calido y acogedor y por el desarrollo de la agricultura.  Guillermo vive al lado de su pareja y juntos tienen un pequeño de 1 años de edad, a quien quiere muchisimo y sobre todo por quien se esfuerza cada día para poder brindarle una vida digna.

Día  a Dia Guillermo trabaja como agricultor, actualmente el tiene una parcela de pecanas, Guillermo le dedica a su cultivo alrededor de 8 horas al dia; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y sobre todo le gusta loque hace.

Guillermo esta muy agradecido con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podra comprar abono y fertilizantes para poder mantener su cultivo de pecano ya que comprara abono y fertilizantes para su pecano y de esta manera el podra tener una mejor cosecha y seguir luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:" Darle una buena educacion a su hijo y poder ser una gran agricultor"
texts.en:
Guillermo is hardworking and has a contagious charisma.  He lives in the city of Ica, which is known for its warm and welcoming climate and for its agriculture.  Guillermo lives with his partner and together they have a one year old child whom they love very much and who gives them the strength each day to be able to continue on and give him a better life. 

Guillermo works daily as a farmer. He currently has a parcel of pecans. He works around 8 hours per day and believes that his business is going well because he is very responsible and above all because it is what he likes to do. 

Guillermo is very appreciative of the Kiva lenders since thanks to their help he can purchase fertilizer and manure to be able to maintain his pecan crop. In this way he can have a better harvest and continue fighting every day to be able to have his biggest dream: to give a good education to his son and to be a great farmer.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Felicien

texts.en:
Felicien is married, with eight children. His wife works as a farmer. He has been an Irish potato grower for 20 years. 

Felicien would like to get this loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, and to support labor costs, in order to get the best harvest. With the profits, Felicien plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output and to buy a cow to provide milk. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and to support labor costs, in order to get the best harvest.

loans.name: Cuyes Dorados Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario cuyes dorados, es un grupo de personas emprendedoras que buscan la manera de salir adelante y de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
La presidenta de este grupo es la Sra. Gloria es una mujer de 54 años que vive en la ciudad Latacunga, ella tiene un hijo de 20 años, Gloria vive junto a su esposo y su hijo, Gloria se define como una persona  alegre, honrada, respetuosa muy trabajadora, Gloria desde mucho tiempo atrás decidió emprender un negocio con el que pueda ayudar económicamente a su esposo, es por ello que se dedicó a la crianza y venta de animales, dándole buenos resultados y mejorando la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
El crédito solicitado a FODEMI será invertido en la compra de cuyes pequeños para la crianza y la posterior venta, además se invertirá en la adecuación de las jaulas donde se criaran los cuyes. Gloria está convencida de invertir en su negocio ya que le está yendo cada vez mejor y está teniendo mayores ingresos económicos. 
Gloria quiere cumplir su sueño de tener un criadero grande de cuyes para ser una microempresaria distribuidora para los mercados de su ciudad, y con esto ayudar en la educación de su hijo.
texts.en:
The “Cuyes Dorados” (Golden Guinea Pigs) mutually supportive group is a group of enterprising people seeking to get ahead and improve their families’ quality of life.

The group president is Gloria, a 54-year-old woman living in the city of Latacunga.  She has a 20-year-old son.  Gloria lives with her son and husband and Gloria defines herself as a cheerful, honest, respectful and very hardworking woman.  Some time ago she decided to start a business to help her husband economically and she decided to raise animals to sell.  It had good results and her entire family’s quality of life has improved.

The loan she’s asking FODEMI for is to buy baby guinea pigs to raise for subsequent sale.  She will also invest in setting up the cages where she’ll raise them.  Gloria is convinced about investing money in her business because she’s doing better every time and she’s earning higher income.

Gloria wants to reach her dream of having a large guinea pig nursery to become a micro businesswoman supplying her city’s markets and with this be able to help with her son’s education.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and to set up cages.

loans.name: Maxwell

texts.en:
Maxwell sells provisions in Bremawg, near Abura. She has received no formal education. She is single and has one child. 

Maxwell has been selling provisions for some time now. She is responsible for supporting herself and her child. She will use her loan to purchase more provisions for sale in her shop. She hopes to use part of the new profits from her business to save, and the rest to re-invest into her provisions store.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions for sale in her shop.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is married and has three children, aged between five and ten. His wife works as a farmer. He has grown Irish potatoes for 15 years. Emmanuel would like this loan to buy fertilizers and seeds, and pay for the labor needed to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been farming. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds, and pay for the labor needed to get the best harvest

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es:
José tiene 21 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene dos hijos. Desde hace aproximadamente cinco años, se dedica a la crianza de novillos en repasto, oficio que aprendió junto a su papá; debido a que no pudo estudiar. Mediante este oficio, Manuel obtiene su única fuente de ingresos, para el sostenimiento de su familia. Para comprar los novillos, él viaja en un camión desde su comunidad hasta el tiangue, lugar en donde compra los animales, el viaje tarda unos cuarenta y cinco minutos. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar dos novillos para engordarlos en repasto y luego venderlos. Con la inversión, estará seguro de continuar con su negocio y asegurara los ingresos para sostenimiento de su familia. Su deseo, es ahorrar para construir su casa de ladrillo, debido a que actualmente vive en casa que no es de él.
texts.en:
José is 21 years old. He has two children with his life partner. Approximately five years ago, he began to make a living raising bulls on pasture, a trade he learned from his father since he was not able to study. This is José's single source of income from which to support his family. To buy the bulls he raises, José travels by truck to the market 45 minutes away, where animals are sold.

He is requesting this loan from Fundación Campo in order to buy two bulls to fatten in his pastures and later sell. With this investment, he will be able to continue his business and ensure an income to support his family. José's wish, is to save enough money to build a brick house, because right now he does not own the house he lives in.

loans.use: to buy two bulls to fatten on pasture and later sell.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa is married and has four children. She has received no formal education. Yaa sells cooked rice in Bremawg near Abura, which she has done for several years now. Her husband is a farmer. Yaa uses her income to pay for her children’s school fees and support her husband with the family’s expenses. Yaa will use the loan to purchase greater quantities of rice to prepare for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Yaa plans to invest more money in her rice making business and be able to save a little more money for the family’s future.

loans.use: to purchase greater quantities of rice to prepare for sale.

loans.name: Seth

texts.en:
Seth is married and has eight children. His wife works as a farmer. He has been an Irish potato grower for 10 years. He would like to get this loan to buy fertilizers and seeds, and to support labor costs in order to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds, and to support labor costs in order to get the best harvest

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is a hairdresser in Bremawg near Abura. Aba has received no formal education.  She is single and has 2 children. Aba has been a hairdresser for some time now. She is responsible for supporting herself and her children. Her loan will be used to purchase shampoos, hair extensions and other products needed for her hairdressing services. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to improve and expand her hairdressing business to service more clients in her community.

loans.use: to purchase shampoos, hair extensions and other products needed for her hairdressing services.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is married and has a seven month-old child. His wife works as a farmer. He has been an Irish potato grower for seven years. He would like to get this loan to buy fertilizers and seeds, and support labor costs in order to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output and build a house near the trading center for commercial purposes.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds, and support labor costs in order to get the best harvest

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is a fishmonger who sells smoked and fried fish in Bremawg near Abura.  Adjoa has received no formal education.  She is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer in the area. Adjoa has been selling prepared fish for sometime now. She is responsible for paying to support her husband and paying her children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more fish, to fry or smoke, to sell in the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her fish selling trade and meet the local demand.

loans.use: to buy more fish, to fry or smoke, and sell in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua is divorced and has six children. She has received no formal education. Akosua sells cooked rice in Bremawg near Abura, which she has done for the past six years. Akosua supports her family on her income alone, including payment of her children’s school fees. 

Akosua will use the loan to purchase more rice for preparation and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Akosua plans to further increase the production of her rice-making business.

loans.use: to purchase more rice for preparation and sale.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 50-year-old farmer from Kutaisi District. He lives with his wife and two children (8 and 15 years old). The children go to the local school. David’s wife works at the local bakery and gets a small monthly salary. The family owns a calf and a milk cow, whose milk is used for cheese production. The cheese is sold on the local market. Also, the family owns a vineyard; they seasonally sell grapes and wine. Along with the above-mentioned income sources, David grows maize on the family-owned agricultural land. He also locally works as an artisan and gets a small monthly income. 

The loan will be used to purchase an additional milk cow. When the family has two cows, David will produce and sell more cheese. That will increase the income of the family. For the future, David plans to invest more in his dairy farm and increase the number of his cows. Another part of the loan will be used for purchasing piglets. He will place the piglets in a shed located in their yard, raise them, and after several months, the pigs will be able to produce piglets. This will increase the family's animal husbandry business and their income, as well. With the increased income, David will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and piglets.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margret lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya, which is a popular banana growing region. She has 6 children. Margret has been farming for 20 years and her primary income sources are eggs, tea and crops. She states that the most enjoyable thing about farming is, "helps me get income!" Margret's biggest challenge is the lack of market. One animal on the  farm is named 'Maridadi'.

Margret will use this 40,000 KES loan from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow. When asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, Margret replied, "was interested in dairy farming."  When asked what she learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, she replied, "learned to save." Margret's highest monthly expense is school fees. 

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Margret owns a cow, poultry and a pump but does not own a pig, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. Margret has in her household mosquito nets, solar power and a TV but does not have electricity, running water, a sewing machine or a DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and sent the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es:
Con 46 años de edad Zonia es una mujer cuya presencia en  múltiples actividades es activa. Comparte una vida conyugal con Damian de 45 años y junto a el tiene el orgullo de haber inculcado una educación sólida a 3 de sus cuatros hijos hoy ya mayores y trabajadores.
Es propietaria de una vivienda construida a base de material noble.
Dedicada anteriormente a la venta de comida opto por incursionar en la venta de catálogos a domicilio en donde hallo en ella una gran habilidad para las ventas y un trabajo menos forzado.
Lleva casi 5 meses en el negocio y se siente muy motivada por como sus clientas van solicitando pedidos entre los cuales destacan los cosméticos entre otros.
Le agrada mucho su actividad puesto que ha logrado entablar muchas amistades logrando hasta hoy conocer a muchas personas. A pesar de ello es conciente del esfuerzo adicional que debe emplear puesto que el recorrer las diversas arterias de su localidad la agota.
Al tener una buena demanda planea realizar la compra de cosméticos al por mayor  los cuales obtiene a buen precio por ser asesora de belleza.
Tiene el desea de a futuro incursionar en la compra de un lote a afueras de la ciudad y junto a Damian iniciar un negocio de un mini recreo campestre en donde espera iniciarse en el rubro de servicio. Requiere contar con 2,000 nuevos soles y así adquirir cosméticos y otros al por mayor logrando obtener ganancias adicionales.
texts.en:
Zonia, 46 years old, is a very active woman. She is married to Damian, who is 45 years old. With Damian, Zonia has had the pleasure of providing her three children (who are now working adults) with a solid education. Zonia owns her own house made from good material. She used to work selling food, but she recently opted to venture into selling items from catalogs door-to-door. In this work, she discovered her aptitude for retail and a less demanding way to make a living.

Zonia has been selling from these catalogs for five months now and she feels very motivated by the success she has had finding customers with orders to fill. She sells cosmetics more than any other product. Zonia is grateful for this job since it has allowed her to strike up new friendships and to meet many new people each day. Nevertheless, she realizes that she will need to work even harder to take full advantage of the potential for sales in her region.

Since demand is so high, Zonia plans to buy cosmetics at wholesale in order to get discounted prices. In the future, Zonia wishes to buy a lot at the edge of the city and, together with Damian, open a small restaurant and being working in the service industry.

Zonia is requesting a loan of 2,000 Peruvian soles to buy cosmetics and other items at wholesale in order to increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy a variety of cosmetics.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, 37 years old, is married and has two children. She lives in the coastal region of Kenya. Alice is an enterprising person who is a fighter. 

Alice has a small business selling fish from her home. The business helps her obtain income to be able to support her family. Alice is asking for this loan to buy stock of fish and cooking oil. Her dream is to progress in her business and to help her family move ahead.

loans.use: to buy stock of fish and cooking oil.

loans.name: Givi

texts.en:
Givi is a 68-year-old farmer from the village Sakulia in Tskaltubo District. He lives with his wife Eter and their 25-year-old son. Givi and Eter are provided with retirement pension. The family makes a living working in agriculture. In particular, they have a dairy farm with eight cows. They produce cheese and sell it at the local open market. 

Givi doesn’t own a car, so he has to rent one for transportation of their products. Renting the car is quite expensive and not cost-efficient. With the requested credit Givi will purchase a car. Not having to rent a car will decrease his transportation expenses, thus his profit margin will grow. With the increased income, the family's living conditions will improve.

loans.use: to purchase car for product transportation

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu, 48, lives with her husband and six children in a rented house. She makes a living selling cassava. Her product is top-quality and affordable, and her service is excellent.

She's well known in the area where she lives. She has a lot of experience in sales and has acquired many customers, which allows her to stay ahead of the competition and get the best profits.

Tabu is a woman who loves her job. She works from an early hour, so at the end of the day she can share the most important thing with her family. She works hard because she knows that, by the end of the day, she is required to place some food on the table.

Tabu is asking for a loan to add to her stock of cassava for sale.

loans.use: to add to her stock of cassava for sale.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya, which is a popular banana growing region. She has 3 children. Gladys has been farming for 21 years and her primary income sources are eggs, tea, crops and personal business. Gladys states that tea farming is the most enjoyable aspect to farming and that her biggest challenge is growing tomatoes. One of the animals on the farm is named 'Nyabarati'.

Gladys has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to help her buy poultry. When asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, Gladys replied, "The interest is favourable." When asked what she learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, Glady replied, "that savings is an important part of it." Gladys' highest monthly expense is school fees. Gladys states that this loan will benefit her family by enabling her children to get adequate education. As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Gladys owns a cow, poultry and a pump but does not own pigs, a bicycle, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. Gladys has in her household mosquito nets but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, TV or DVD. Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and sent the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Jamleck

texts.en:
Jamleck lives in the Murang'a area of Kenya, which is situated near Nairobi. He has five children. He has been a farmer for 32 years.  His primary income sources are tea and other crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "The income!" His biggest challenge is "Lack of capital to start projects." An animal on the farm has been given the name of Osama. 

Jamleck will use the loan to buy a water tank for the farming business. He was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "Juhudi Kilimo offers loans for buying assets for farming." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session, and he said, "That microfinance can help a farmer to expand and do intensive farming."

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan would benefit his family, Jamleck replied that he would be able to pay the children's school fees.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Jamleck owns the following: 'poultry, pump, bicycle' but does not own 'cow, pig, motorcycle, automobile.' Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, solar power, running water, TV, DVD' but does not have 'electricity, sewing machine.'

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy a water tank for the farming business.

loans.name: Lasha

texts.en:
Lasha, 35 years old, lives in a small village in the Kareli district with his wife, 3 daughters and parents. His father receives a retirement pension. The family runs an agricultural business. They have 3 cows, whose milk is used in cheese production. They also have 2.5 hectares of agricultural land, where they grow haricots and apple trees. The family sells the harvested products and cheese locally at a good price. Each member of the family works hard to ensure a good harvest.

Lasha has a grocery shop, where his wife works. He has requested a loan to purchase stock for the shop in order to increase sales. This will boost the family's income and improve their living conditions. Lasha awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase stock for the grocery shop

loans.name: Damas Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité Damas Unidas nace gracias al interés de una de las miembros del grupo, quien queriendo ayudar a sus amigas y vecinas las invito a formar un grupo.
 La Sra. Eustaquia, es parte de este grupo y se dedica a las ventas, ya que tiene una despensa bien surtida en su casa. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que con su trabajo y su empeño está saliendo adelante, quiere poder seguir trabajando y creciendo y también agrandando su negocio.
Solicita de este crédito y quiere invertirlo en cargar con mas productos su despensa, con verduras, carnes, panchos, fideos, arroz, etc, con lo que podrá seguir teniendo buena variedad para sus clientes.
texts.en:
The community bank Damas Unidas was born thanks to the initiative of one of the members of the group.  She wanted to help her friends and neighbors and thus invited them to form the community bank.

Eustaquia is a member of this group and runs a well-stocked grocery store out of her home.  She is a very hardworking person who is getting ahead through her work and her painstaking efforts.  She wants to be able to keep working and growing and also to expand her business.

She is seeking this loan on order to purchase more goods for her store, such as vegetables, meat, hot dogs, noodles, rice and other items.  This will enable her to continue to offer a good variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, hot dogs, noodles, rice and other items.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa de 49 años es una madre muy comprometida con trabajo y casada con Alberto de 49 años. Ambos tienen como logro al haber educado a sus hijos hoy ya mayores e independientes por las buenas riendas de la responsabilidad.
Es propietaria de una vivienda a base de adobe adquirida con el apoyo de su esposo.
Desde hace 10 años viene dedicándose junto a Alberto a producir cacao orgánico  así como café del valle siendo este un gran sustento para su familia desde el inicio de sus actividades.
Siempre contando en ocasiones con el apoyo de jornaleros trabajan prácticamente todo el año en las diversas tareas de campaña. 
Lo agradable de su trabajo son las ganancias que perciben al expender sus producción en los centro de acopio de su localidad para el cual tienen actualmente dificultades en cuanto al transporte, esperando adquirir un vehiculo menor a futuro.
A manera de mejorar sus ingresos tiene en mente ampliar sus plantaciones de cacao puesto que sus parcelas poseen tierras muy fértiles y llegan a producir mazorcas de muy buen calidad.
Uno de sus planes a futuro es la apertura de un negocio consistente en una tienda a abarrotes pequeña para generar ingresos paralelos a sus actividades en el campo siendo este un negocio con mucha demanda en su barrio. Desea contar con 1,500 nuevos soles para la compra de sacos con guano de isla y la contrata de jornaleros para el deshierbo de sus plantaciones de cacao esperando así obtener como siempre una calidad óptima para los acopiadores.
texts.en:
Rosa, 49, is a woman who is very committed to her work.  She is married to Alberto, 49, and together they have managed to get their children an education.  Today their children are grown and live independently, having taken up the reins of responsibility.

Rosa owns a house made of adobe which she acquired through the support of her husband.

For 10 years she has been farming alongside Alberto, producing organic cocoa and coffee in the valley.  This has been a great means of support for her family ever since they started this activity.

They work just about all year on the various farming tasks, at times relying on the help of dayworkers.  What Rosa likes about her work are the earnings that they are paid when they sell their products to the wholesalers in their area.  One difficulty they have is transporting their products; they are hoping to acquire a small vehicle in the future.  

In order to increase their income, they are thinking about expanding their cocoa plantings, since the parcels of land that they have are very fertile and they can produce very good quality cocoa pods.

One of their plans for the future is to open a business consisting of a small grocery store, so that they can generate another stream of income in addition to their farming business, since there is a lot of demand for this type of business in their neighborhood.  They are seeking 1,500 Peruvian sole to buy sacks of guano (organic fertilizer), and to hire workers to weed their coffee fields.  They hope that in this way they will obtain, as always, optimal quality products to sell to the wholesalers.

loans.use: to buy sacks of bird guano and to hire workers to weed her coffee fields

loans.name: Mesrop

texts.en:
Mesrop lives in Por village with his wife. He works at the local village hall, and he is also involved in agriculture. Together with his wife, Mesrop keeps livestock, which currently includes 3 cows and 12 chickens, and grows peach, apricot, nut, apple and pear trees. Mesrop's monthly salary is hardly enough to cover the family's basic costs, and agriculture helps him to have a stable income during each month.

Mesrop would like to improve his agricultural activity and expand it. He has applied for this loan to purchase a cow and forage for feeding it. This will help Mesrop to gather more milk, sales of which will significantly increase his income. The loan is very important for Mesrop, to improve his and his wife's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and forage for feeding it.

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is a 32-year-old married woman living with her life companion and their two children in the suburban area of Kisauni. She set up a space attached to her house one year ago where she runs her food business selling fried potatoes. She works hard, starting very early in the day to prepare the food for breakfast.

She is asking for this loan to buy a sack of raw potatoes and cooking oil. She wants to keep the business active in order to provide good customer service and increase sales and profits. Her dreams are to make the business grow and to use her profits to obtain personal and familial well-being.

loans.use: to buy a sack of raw potatoes and cooking oil.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos está casado y tiene tres hijos que están en etapa escolar, viven en casa propia ocupando dos habitaciones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz.
Santos es peluquero y trabaja por más de doce horas al día en su peluquería, ya que con lo que gana debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para ampliar y aumentar el capital en su peluquería dotándose de máquinas cortadoras para diferentes cortes y estilos de cabello y con esto  desea mejorar sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Santos es construir más habitaciones en su casa para poder dar
más comodidad y seguridad a su familia.
Santos es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 1999 y ésta es la tercera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Santos is married and has three school age children; they all live in his own, two-bedroom house located in the city of La Paz’s Achachicala zone.

Santos is a barber and works more than 12 hours daily in his barber shop since what he earns is used to pay for food, schooling and basic utility costs for his family.  He needs the loan to expand and increase his barber shop’s capital purchasing hair clippers for different haircuts and hair styles; with this he hopes to improve his income to improve his quality of life.

Santos' dream is to build more rooms onto his house to provide more comfort for his family.  Santos has been an IMPRO client since 1999 and this is his third time with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy hair clippers.

loans.name: Goldy

texts.es:
Goldy  es divorciada y tiene dos hijos, vive en anticretico (acuerdo legal entre dueño de casa e inquilino por el que se acuerda un monto de dinero por un plazo no menor a un año, al cabo del cual el dinero será retornado al inquilino y éste deberá desalojar la habitación o departamento) ya hace un año, ella cuenta con las dependencias necesarias de un departamento donde tiene un ambiente la cual la utiliza como taller de costura; la casa es ladrillo y el piso es de madera, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Llojeta Bajo de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como artesana en costura de ropa en tela polar, ella  elabora buzos deportivos, chaquetas y cada fin de semana entrega su producto a una amiga la cual se encarga de vender en los mercados y ferias de La Paz; estos ingresos le sirven para poder cubrir gastos de transporte y alimentación.  El crédito requiere para la compra de materia prima (tela polar) para poder confeccionar  más ropa y así mejorar sus ingresos.
El sueño de Goldy es poder contar con una vivienda propia y asi poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y KIVA.
texts.en:
Goldy is divorced and has two children.  She’s been living  in the ‘anticrético’ modality (a legal agreement between a homeowner and a tenant in which an amount of money is agreed upon for a term of no more than a year at the end of which the money is returned to the tenant who must then vacate the home or apartment) for a year now.  She has use of an apartment with all necessary space for a sewing workshop.  The house is brick with a wood floor and it’s located in the city of La Paz’s Llojeta 
Bajo neighborhood.

She currently works as a sewing artisan manufacturing weatherproof clothes.  She makes sports sweatshirts and jackets and every weekend delivers her goods to a girlfriend who takes care of selling them in the markets and street markets in La Paz.  Income earned is used for her transportation and food costs.  She needs the loan to buy raw materials (weatherproof fabric) to make more clothes thus improving her income.  Goldy’s dream is to own a house to improve her quality of life.  This is her first loan request to IMPRO and to KIVA.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: José Porfirio

texts.es:
El señor José Porfirio  reside  en  la Cuidad  de Masaya, cuna de artesano y del Folklore,  cuenta con  31 años de edad,  de oficio pintor, casado y responsable de su hogar. Su núcleo familiar lo componen su esposa, su hijo pequeño.

Su negocio consiste en la elaboración de cuadro de paisajes variados de todos los tamaños, tiene la experiencia de 17 años dedicados  a esta labor, lo que le ha permitido adquirir una gran experiencia en dicho trabajo, sus cuadros los comercializa en ferias, en el mercado de Artesanía y en la parte de artesanía del mercado municipal, como artista destacado le ha permitido enviar en exhibición sus cuadros hasta Holanda.
