El señor José está solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como lienzo, pintura oleo verde, azul, rojo, negro, violeta, blanco, amarillo, pintura látex mate base, vestidores 15x30 pulgada, 20x34 y 28x45 pulgadas.

Considera que este financiamiento  le ayudara a optimizar  sus ingresos, lo que ayudara a mejorar su nivel de vida y el de su familia quien dependen de el.
texts.en:
José Porfirio lives in Masaya, a city that is rich in art and folklore.  He is thirty-one years old and is a painter by profession.  He is married and is responsible for supporting his wife and young son.

His business consists of painting various landscapes in all sizes.  He has seventeen years of experience in this, which has enabled him to acquire a great deal of skill.  He sells his paintings in the artists' market, the municipal market and various other markets.  As a distinguished artist, his paintings have been shown as far away as Holland.

He is seeking a loan in order to buy materials such as canvas, oil paints in green, blue, red, black, purple, white, yellow; matte paint; and frames in the sizes 15" x 30", 20" x 34" and 28" x 45".

He believes that this loan will help him to optimize his income and that it will help him to improve the standard of living for his family, who depend on him.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as oil and latex paints, canvas, and frames in a variety of sizes.

loans.name: Altise

texts.en: Altise is an EarthSpark clean energy entrepreneur selling Lanp Enèji Pwòp solar light bulbs on a rent-to-own basis. She lives in Chardonnieres, Haiti about a 6 hours drive from Port-au-Prince in an area without access to electricity. She first started selling EarthSpark products after being a customer. She had bought a Lanp Enèji Pwòp to replace her sooty kerosene stove. After noticing that her son’s eyes didn’t water while studying with a Lanp Enèji Pwòp the way they had under a kerosene lamp, she decided she wanted to spread the word within her community. She currently has 30 customers renting out Lanp Enèji Pwòp and will soon be expanding her solar entrepreneurship business. Altise is asking for a loan of 200 USD so that she can add TiPowa solar desk lamps to her inventory.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is 45 years old and lives in Kisauni with her family. She is characterized as a serious, calm and correct person who likes to do things well and with care. She is very dedicated to her work, and takes care of her children.

She works selling snacks and juice from her home. She has established a good number of regular clients.  She started this business with a small amount of capital that her husband gave her. 

She will use this loan to buy more fruits and sugar and also more snacks to sell.  Her dream is to open a food stall in future.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and sugar and also more snacks to sell.

loans.name: Junior

texts.en: Junior lives in Port-au-Prince, Haiti. Even though he has a university degree he is currently unemployed. He has worked with EarthSpark before helping on marketing our clean energy products. He would now like to launch his first business by becoming an EarthSpark Clean Energy Entreprenuer. With a Kiva loan, Junior will be set up with a “Business in a Bag”, a kit containing a personalized mix of small-scale clean energy products, marketing materials and training on energy literacy, SMS tracking of sales, and basic business skills.  He is looking for a loan of 260 dollars to purchase stock for kerosene stoves and charcoal-efficient cookstoves because these are the products most in demand in his area. Both of these stoves help minimize the effects of charcoal on the environment by reducing carbon emissions and the need to cut down trees to produce charcoal.

loans.use: inventory for a clean energy business.

loans.name: Patrique

texts.en:
Patrique lives in Cap Haitian, in the North of Haiti. He doesn’t have electricity in his home and there is not access to solar products in his community.  For two years Patrique has been the Coordinator of the Organization des Jeunes Visionnaires Haïtiens Pour des Actions Sociales (Organization of Haitian Youth Visionaries for Social Action). This is a group of young adults who work in their community, putting on cultural and sporting events and taking part in community health activities such as campaigns against cholera. 

The group has graduated from a year-long government training in leadership skills and is now looking for entrepreneurial opportunities. Patrique would like to become an EarthSpark clean energy agent so that he can purchase products in bulk and set up other members of his group with an EarthSpark  “Business in a Bag”, a kit containing a personalized mix of small-scale clean energy products, marketing materials and training on energy literacy, SMS tracking of sales, and basic business skills.  

Patrique has recently finished government training on energy access in Haiti and is very dedicated to providing his community with clean energy solutions. He would like to sell EarthSpark products to help prevent blackouts and help people use renewable sources of energy that are better for their health and the environment in Haiti. He is in interested in all EarthSpark products but will start out with solar desk lamps, solar light bulbs and kerosene stoves.

loans.use: Inventory for Clean Energy Entrepreneurship!

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew lives in the Kitale area of Kenya, which has a high regional output of maize. He has 5 children. Andrew has been farming for 23 years and his primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, transportation services and the salary from his job. Andrew states that the most enjoyable aspects to farming are dairy keeping and feeding dairy cows. His biggest challenges are animal diseases and expensive dairy feeds. Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Maua' and 'Matui'.

Andrew will use this loan to buy and insure a dairy cow. When asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for the loan, Andrew replied, "I liked the conditions under which Juhudi Kilimo gives loans to farmers." When asked what he learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, Andrew said, "the importance of using the loans given for the intended purpose." Andrew's highest monthly expense is school fees. He says that this loan will benefit his family by providing them with milk and other basic requirements such as education for the children. As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Andrew owns cows, poultry, a pump, a bicycle and a motorcycle but does not own pigs or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. Andrew has in his household mosquito nets, a sewing machine, TV and DVD but does not have electricity, solar power or running water. Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and sent the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Louis Charles

texts.en: Louis Charles lives in Tiburon, Haiti, about a 7-hour drive from the capital Port-au-Prince. Tiburon is not connected to the national electrical grid. There is smaller private source of electricity but it does not reach everyone and only provides power for 3 hours per day.  He already has a successful business across from a bus station serving Haitians travelling to and from the capital and sells rice, sugar, and motor parts. He would like to expand his business and sell clean energy products with EarthSpark International. He wants to sell EarthSpark products because there isn’t a lot of access to small-scale solar products in his area and he believes that with EarthSpark products people will realize that with light they can do things they weren’t able to do before. He would like a 1000-dollar loan so that he can launch his clean energy entrepreneurship by purchasing solar desk lamps, solar light bulbs and charcoal-efficient miracle stoves.

loans.use: stock for a clean energy business.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en alquiler en la casa de sus tíos ocupando cinco habitación pero comparte las demás dependencias con sus tíos, las paredes están revocadas con estuco y el piso es de tablones y cemento, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Norte de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como procurador en un bufete de abogados realizando tramites de legalización ya hace un año percibiendo un salario mensual. Miguel  colabora con los pagos de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para el pago de  los trámites de egreso de su carrera de la facultad de derecho y poder ejercer como abogado y así poder tener un ingreso más y mejorar sus ingresos.
El sueño de Miguel Ángel es adquirir su propio estudio jurídico y poder manejar sus propios casos y poder tener personas que le colaboren como él lo hizo en la ciudad de La Paz y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y KIVA.
texts.en:
Miguel is single and has no children.  He lives as a renter in his aunt and uncle’s five-bedroom house but shares all space with them.  The walls are dressed with stucco and the floor is cement and wood.  The house is located in the Norte zone of La Paz.

He currently works as an attorney for a law office doing legal work; he’s been employed for a year and earns a monthly salary.  Miguel contributes towards the family’s basic costs.  He needs the loan to pay for law school graduation costs so that he can practice as a lawyer and earn more income and improve his income.

Miguel Ángel’s dream is to open his own law office and handle his own cases and hire staff to work with him like he’s done in La Paz thus improving his quality of life.  This is the first time he’s requested credit from IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to pay law school graduation costs.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es:
Florinda, de 49 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser alegre y amable, esta separada hace 03 años atrás, fruto de esa unión tienen 02 hijos de 18 y 27 años de edad, habitando su propia casa que logró construir con mucho esfuerzo.
La actividad que realiza Florinda  es la venta de productos de belleza los cuales compra por catalogo y los vende entre sus amistades, además de contar con un salón de belleza instalado en su propia casa, ubicado cerca de un mercado de su localidad. Ahí atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes brindándoles un buen servicio. Ella se inicio su negocio hace 04 años, con un pequeño crédito que obtuvo. 
Considera rentable su negocio ya que cuenta con muchos clientes y casi todos lo días atiende si parar. Le gusta su negocio de belleza pues aprendió en un centro de educación ocupacional, donde logró aprender todo lo relacionado a la belleza y sus productos, ahora contando con los ingresos económicos que le genera su actividad económica, desea continuar con su negocio, y con la ganancias desea ampliar su salón de belleza para poder atender a más personas  y darles una mejor comodidad a sus clientes.  Espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado comenta se siente cómodo con su banco comunal pues considera a sus integrantes ser personas responsables y amables.
Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en compra de materiales para implementar su salón de belleza como tintes, líquidos de uñas, champúes y otros.
texts.en:
Florinda, who is 49 years old, is a hard-working and dedicated woman, in addition to being happy and friendly. She was separated 3 years ago. From her marriage she has two children, ages 18 and 27. She lives in her own house, which she managed to build with great effort.

Florinda's work is selling beauty products, which she buys through catalogs and sells personally to her friends from her house, in addition to haveing a beauty salon set up in her own house, where she tends very kindly to her customers, offering them good service. She began 4 years ago with a loan from MFP, and she does all the work herself.

She considers her business profitable because she has many customers and her shop is located in a market where great numbers of people come every day to do their shopping. She likes her beauty business, since she learned at a center for occupational education, where she managed to learn about everything related to beauty and its products. Now, having the income that her business generates, she wants to continue with her business, and with the earnings she wants to expand her beauty salon to be able to handle more customers and offer them better comfort. She hopes for a small loan so that she can achieve her goals. She also comments that she feels comfortable with her communal bank because she considers its members to be responsible and friendly people.

With 800 PEN she has applied for, she will invest in the purchase of materials to outfit her beauty salon, such as dyes, treatments for fingernails, shampoos, and other items.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of supplies to outfit her beauty salon, such as dyes, nail treatments, shampoos, and other items.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa, de 30 años de edad, es una mujer soñadora y entusiasta, con muchas ganas de progresar y brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Es soltera y tiene 1 hijo de 5 años. Vive a lado de su hijo cómodamente instalada en su propia casa en compañía de su cuñada y sus pequeños hijos.
La actividad que realiza Luisa es el servicio de cosmetología. Atiende a diversos clientes que requieren de algún arreglo estético como corte de cabello, tintes, coloraciones, cuidado de pies y manos, maquillaje y otros. Además, vende productos de belleza femeninos como tintes, esmaltes, labiales, perfumes y otros. Su clientela son sus amigos y otras personas que acuden a ella por recomendación.  Brinda siempre un trato amable y cordial, esta cualidad le ha servido para que gane siempre buenos clientes los mismos que con el paso del tiempo se vuelven también en sus clientes habituales. Se inició en esta actividad hace más de 2 años y hasta el momento lo realiza sola. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja gracias a su fiel clientela que ha logrado consolidar con el paso de los años. Afirma que no tenía problemas económicos antes de iniciar su negocio, pero se decidió aventurarse en este rubro para tener una ocupación en su tiempo libre, ahora se siente una empresaria próspera e independiente. Espera continuar su negocio y poco a poco implementar un espacio en su casa para que pueda atender con mayor comodidad. Este es el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP. Está contenta y agradecida con las personas que hacen posible su crédito que le servirá para continuar con sus planes. Por eso se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores. Además comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera personas amables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles, comprará artículos que usa en su trabajo de cosmetóloga como tintes capilares, cremas, peines y otros.
texts.en:
Luisa, 30, is a dreamer and an enthusiastic person. 

She has the will to move forward and give a higher quality of life to her family. She is a single mother with a son of 5 years. She lives comfortably right beside her son, her sister-in-law and her children in her own house. 
Luisa earns her living through cosmological services. She attends to a diverse clientele who require some kind of aesthetic change, such as a hair trim, dyeing, coloring, hand and foot care, makeup, as well as other things. She also sells feminine beauty products which include dyes, nail polish, lip stick, perfume, and other things. 

Her customers are her friends and people who were recommended to her. She offers a friendly and polite service. This kind of quality has served her to always obtain good customers who often become frequent clients. 

She began this business 2 years ago, and up until this point, she has done it alone. She considers her business profitable due to her client base's loyalty which she has earned over the past few years. 

She says that she did not have any financial troubles before starting the business, but she decided to venture into the cosmological field to have work during her free time. Now, she feel she is a prosperous, independent businesswoman. 

She hopes to continue her work and little by little introduce a space in her home so she can attend to her customers more comfortably. 

This is Luisa's second loan with MFP. She feels happy and grateful because of the people who made her loan possible. For this reason, she promises to be punctual in her payments like in previous loans. 

With the 800 nuevos soles she is requesting, she will buy products that she uses in her cosmology work, such as dyes, hair treatments, creams, combs, and other things.

loans.use: to buy dyes, hair treatments, creams, combs, and other things for her cosmology business.

loans.name: Kenia Yuritza

texts.es:
Doña Kenia, reside  en la cuidad  de Masaya, conocida también como cuidad de las Flores, es madre soltera, tiene la edad de 26 años, su núcleo familiar  lo compone su mama, su niña y ella,  Posee  su propio negocio, el cual  consiste en la elaboración de tortillas hechas a base de maíz, venta de leña y frijoles cocidos, posee su negocio desde hace 8 años, ella misma se encarga de elaborarlas las tortillas y de venderlas en su casa de habitación, ahí tiene concentrada su clientela que es fija, además que la tortilla es unos de los componente típico para las comidas del nicaragüense.

 A raíz de que no pudo conseguir un trabajo estable, tomo la decisión de emprender su propio negocio, ya que es la que tiene que trabajar para poder mantener a su mama y su única hija. 

En estos momentos esta necesitando invertir en  su negocio ya que la temporada en estos meses es buena, por lo que esta solicitando  un financiamiento que le  permita mejorar su negocio, sus  ingreso para el hogar y una mejor atención a su clientela
texts.en:
Kenia lives in the city of Masaya, also known as the city of the flowers.  She is a 26-year-old single mother.  Her nuclear family is comprised of her mother, her daughter and herself.  She has her own business making corn tortillas and cooking beans, along with selling firewood.

She has had this business for eight years.  She makes all of the tortillas herself and sells them out of her home.  She has a steady base of customers as the tortilla is one of the core components typical of Nicaraguan cuisine.

Since she was not able to get a stable job when she was younger, she decided to open her own business, as she needs to work in order to support her mother and her only child.

Currently she needs to invest in her business, as she has a lot of orders at this time of year.  Thus, she is seeking a loan that will enable her to improve her business, provide better service to her customers, and increase her household income.

loans.use: to buy split firewood, corn, lime and a grill for her tortillas.  It will also allow her to make repairs to her kitchen.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio, de 66 años, es un hombre amable, bueno y muy dinámico, convive con su pareja desde hace 38 años llamada Teodolinda quien la apoya en todo lo que hace y junto a ella tuvo 5 hijos quienes ya son mayores e independientes, durante mucho tiempo el ha trabajado para así poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, ahora que ya son mayores el solo desea tener un respaldo para tener una vejez tranquila a lado de su cónyuge. El trabajo de Julio consiste en la venta de golosinas y postres elaborado por sus propias manos. Vende todo tipo de galletas, caramelos, dulces, queques, bizcochos, tortas y bebidas refrescantes. Julio es el indicado para cumplir con esta función ya que él prepara sus postres y refrescos usando los mejores ingredientes y las mejores frutas tropicales de la ciudad. Tiene un pequeño puesto en el mercado de mayor concurrencia de la ciudad, atiende desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, cualquier persona que llega a su establecimiento termina satisfecho y con ganas de volver pronto porque sus postres son exquisitos, gracias a los 11 años que lleva en esta actividad ha podido acentuar el gusto y sabor perfecto que caracterizan a sus postres.
Trabaja siempre solo, ya que su labor no requiere de mucho esfuerzo en la atención, sin embargo en la preparación de los dulces a veces es necesario contar con la ayuda de su pareja, lo que más le pone feliz es observar a sus clientes degustar con mucho placer los postres que el vende y cuando nuevamente  le piden repetición sabe que está haciendo un buen trabajo. Anhela en algún momento. Este es el crédito numero 15 con MFP, por tanto agradece la confianza que ponen nuevamente en él para acceder al crédito que necesita para continuar con sus objetivos y crecimiento programado, además está muy decidido a cumplir con sus pagos de manera puntual como lo hizo hasta ahora en sus créditos anteriores, le agrada mucho formar parte del grupo al que pertenece, es uno de los más antiguos y casi fundador y conoce a todos los integrantes que participan de manera responsable.
Con el monto solicitado 3000 soles, comprará galletas, caramelos, cereales, frutas, maíz morado, gelatina, flan, harina, leche, mantequilla, huevos y todo lo necesario para continuar preparando los postres que pone a la venta en su negocio.
texts.en:
Julio, 66, is a kind, good, very dynamic man.  He lives with his spouse of 38 years named Teodolinda who supports him in everything he does.  They had five children together who are all now independent adults.  For a long time he’s worked to provide a better quality of life for his children and now that they are adults he wants to have backup so he and his wife can life a worry-free old age.

Julio’s work consists in selling sweets and desserts he makes with his own hands.  He sells all types of cookies, candies, caramels, cakes, sweet rolls, sandwiches and refreshing beverages.  Julio is the right person for this job because he makes the desserts and refreshments using the best ingredients and the best tropical fruit in the city.  He has a small stand in the city’s busiest market.  He’s open from 8 in the morning to 7 at night.  Anyone coming by his stand leaves satisfied and wanting to come back soon because his desserts are delicious.  Thanks to the 11 years he’s been in this business he’s been able to accentuate the perfect taste his desserts are known for.

He always works alone because his work demands much effort with respect to customer service.  However, he sometimes needs his spouse’s help in making the sweets.  What makes him the happiest is watching his customers enjoy the desserts he sells and when they ask for seconds he knows he’s doing a good job.  He hopes at some time

This is MFP loan #15.  He’s grateful for the trust placed in him once again for him to access credit he needs to continue towards his objectives and programmed growth.  Also, he’s very determined to make his payments punctually like he’s done with previous loans.  He very much enjoys being part of the group he belongs to.  He’s one of the longest-standing, almost a founding member, and he knows all the members who participate responsibly.

He will use the requested 3,000 soles to buy cookies, caramels, cereals, fruit, purple corn, gelatin, custard, flour, milk, butter, eggs and everything necessary to continue making the desserts he sells in his business.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es:
Abraham, de 24 años de edad es un hombre responsable y muy trabajador. Vive en compañía de su mamá e hijo Franklin a quien cuida en la casa. A muy temprana edad asumió la responsabilidad de criar a su hijo a la que quiere mucho, “gracias a Dios puedo salir adelante”, comenta muy contento pues el profesa la religión evangélica. Su actividad económica se centra en la agricultura, desde muy temprano se dirige a los terrenos agrícolas que posee en la zona alta de su anexo, donde todas las mañanas se dirige para cuidar de sus cultivos de maíz, alverja y papa en pocas ocasiones, pues en sus inicios tuvo muchas dificultades con la producción del tubérculo, ya que tiende mucho a coger plagas y el precio en el mercado en bajo. Es así que durante muchos años de experiencia pudo tener un negocio estable y ahora con las ganancias que tiene con la venta de sus alimentos a la capital, pudo comprar una motocarro, con el que puede tener un ingreso extra. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece el apoyo económico recibido, el cual le ayudará a mejorar su negocio y a dinamizar sus ventas. Pues tendrá el capital para trabajar, por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Abraham, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para distribuir entre sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Abraham, 24, is a responsible, very hardworking man living with his mother and his son, Franklin, who he cares for in the house he has been raised in since he was a boy.  From a very young age he assumed the responsibility of raising his son who he loves very much.  “Thanks to God I’m able to get ahead,” he comments very happily because he an evangelical Christian.  

His economic activity centers on agriculture.  He heads out very early to his fields that are in his annex’s higher elevations.  He heads out there every morning to care for his corn, pea and sometimes potato crops because at the beginning he had a lot of problems with growing this tuber because it’s susceptible to infestations and its market price is low.  With the many years’ experience he has he’s managed to stabilize his business and now has used profits from selling his food in the capital to buy a car that produces extra income.

This is his 5th MFP loan and he’s grateful for the economic support provided that will help him improve his business and fuel his sales because he’ll have capital to work with.  Because of this, he promises to be punctual with his payments.  He will use the requested money to buy natural fertilizers to spread among his crops.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Imilda

texts.es: Imilda, de 37 años es una mujer sencilla vive al lado de sus 2 hijos: Emily y Harol a los que cuida en una casa alquilada desde hace 4 años.  Desde hace mas de 10 años ella se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir en todas sus variantes, desde  ropas de vestir casual y también deportivas  en su propio taller de diseño que esta ubicada en su casa, confecciona de acuerdo a los pedidos y sus clientes son  comerciantes de prendas de vestir y por la calidad que  ella  produce  sus clientes se hacen permanentes, recientemente  a incorporado en su  taller el alquiler de  trajes de gala para damas que  es una atracción mas  para sus clientes que siempre acuden a ella. su deseo es  mejorar  las maquinas de coser que tiene a nivel industrial. Imilda, invertirá el dinero en la compra de hilos, telas y una máquina de coser si el dinero le alcanza.
texts.en:
Thirty-seven year old Imilda is a simple woman who lives at the side of her two children:  Emily and Harol, whom she has cared for in a rented house for the past four years.  

For more than 10 years, she has made her living making all types of garments, including casual clothing and also sportswear, in her own design workshop, which is located in her house.  She sews according to customer orders, and her clients are clothing sellers.  Because of the quality that she produces, her customers become permanent.  Recently, she incorporated into her workshop the rental of women's formalwear, which is one more attraction for her customers who always come to her.

Her desire is to improve her sewing machines to an industrial level. 

Imilda will invest the money to buy thread, cloth, and a sewing machine, if there is enough money.

loans.use: to buy thread, cloth and a sewing machine, if there is enough money.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline lives in the Muranga area of Kenya, which is a heavy, pineapple-producing region. She has four children and has been doing farming work for 27 years.  Her primary income sources are milk, tea, crops, and a job salary.

Pauline stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Farming gives her independence in that it gives her income and she doesn't rely on anyone to cater for her needs!' Her biggest challenge is, 'lack of reliable labor, forcing her to employ casual laborers who are more expensive. She will use the loan to buy a water tank.

Pauline was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Because she wanted a loan to buy a water tank and the terms from Juhudi Kilimo are favorable.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Microfinance can help small-scale farmers to acquire assets for farming.'

Her highest monthly expense is family expenses. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Pauline replied: 'The family will have access to clean water which she will harvest from the rain.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Pauline owns the following: 'cow, poultry, motorcycle,' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards, based on this loan. This borrower has in the household, 'mosquito net, electricity, running water, TV, DVD,' but does not have 'solar power, sewing machine'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy a water tank for her family.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina, de 36 años siempre fue una mujer pujante y soñadora, nunca duda en poder realizar algo, ya que es alguien que le gusta cumplir con lo que se propone, esta casada con Lucio de 47 años con quien es madre de un hijo, Danny de 20 años, ella trabaja mucho pues desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida y buena educación a su hijo para que pueda enfrentar la vida. 
A diario Karina sale muy temprano de su hogar, se dirige a un mercado muy concurrido de la ciudad en donde tiene una pequeño puesto de condimentos o también como se les conoce en la región “especerías”, ahí ella prepara diferentes combinaciones de condimentos para poder venderlos a sus fieles clientes que siempre van a comprar en su puesto ya que ahí encuentran buen trato y el precio justo por los productos. Lleva realizando su trabajo por 13 años y siempre trabajó sola como hasta ahora.
Todo lo que realiza en su puesto es muy bueno para ella, ya que durante su tiempo trabajando ahí supo ganarse un buen número de clientes que siempre van a comprarle y eso le genera buenas venta y con lo mismo buenas ganancias, espera seguir trabajando mucho para poder hacer crecer su negocio y con lo mismo su economía.
Este es el préstamo número 16 con MFP, siempre fue muy buena socia en su banco comunal en donde la quieren mucho por ser muy responsable y solidaria, agradece a quienes le brindan el préstamo que requiere para seguir aumentando su negocio, esta convencida que seguirá siendo una cliente muy puntual y pagará sus cuotas a tiempo como lo hizo en todos los préstamos que tuvo hasta ahora.
Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará ingredientes, condimentos y especias para aumentar su variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes, como el comino, pimienta, guisador, ajos, culantro, embutidos etc.
texts.en:
Karina, 36, always was a dedicated woman and a dreamer.  She never hesitates to achieve something because she's someone who likes to accomplish what she sets out to.  She's married to Lucio, 47, with whom she's the mother of a 20-year-old child, Dany.  She works a lot because she wants to give her son a better quality of life and a good education so he can face life.

Karina leaves home early every day and goes to a very busy market in the city where she has a small condiment stall or "especería," as it's known in that area.  She makes different combinations of condiments to sell to her loyal customers who always shop at her stall because of her good treatment and the fair prices of her products.  She has been doing this work for 13 years and she always worked alone as she does now.

Everything she does in her stall is very good for her because during her time working there she learned how to acquire a good number of customers who always shop with her, which generates good sales and good profits.  She hopes to continue working a lot to be able to make her business and her finances grow.

This is her sixteenth loan with MFP.  She always was a good member in her communal bank, where she's greatly admired because she's responsible and supportive.  She's grateful to those who will give her the loan she needs to be able to continue expanding her business.  She's convinced that she'll continue to be a very punctual client and that she'll make her payments on time, as she did with all her previous loans.

With the requested amount of 2000 soles [PEN] she'll buy ingredients, condiments, and spices to increase the variety of products she offers to her customers, including cumin, pepper, turmeric, garlic, cilantro, cold meats, etc.

loans.use: to buy cumin, pepper, turmeric, garlic, cilantro, cold meats, etc.

loans.name: Eler

texts.es:
Eler de 58 años, es un hombre soltero. Tiene un hijo mayor, quien vive en la ciudad de Tarma por motivos de estudios. Su vivienda es propia y se ubica en un distrito rural.

Eler, hace más de 15 años empezó la actividad de la herrería. En un ambiente que acondicionó en su hogar, tiene varias máquinas que le permiten construir puertas, ventanas, mesas, y otros objetos a base de metales.
Considera que su negocio es rentable, ya que invierte poco en la materia prima, pero si se esfuerza.
“Lo que más me piden es la reparación de artículos de metal, como sillas, mesas, triciclos y otros; pero los inicios de mes me piden construir puertas y ventas”, comenta orgulloso.
Gracias a esta actividad logró educar  a su hijo.
En los días de mayor trabajo contrata ayudantes a los que paga por sus servicios al día, de otra manera no cubriría con sus labores.
Le gusta su labor, por ello esta vez requiere de su ayuda para adquirir más materiales.
Éste es su crédito número 2 con MFP. Agradece la confianza, por su parte menciona que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Invertirá los 1000 soles en la compra de planchas de metal para construir puertas y ventanas y para la reparación de otros artículos.
texts.en:
Eler is a 58 year-old single man. He has a son of age, who lives in the city of Tarma due to his studies. Eler owns his own home and lives in a rural district.

Eler started his activity as a blacksmith over 15 years ago. He has several machines that allow him to build doors, windows, tables and other metal-based objects in a workshop he arranged for in his house.

He considers his business as a profitable one, since he invests little in raw materials, but he works hard.

"I am mostly asked to repair metal objects, such as chairs, tables, tricycles and others; but in the beginning of the month I am often asked to build doors and windows", he proudly comments.

Thanks to this business, he has been able to give his son an education.

In the busiest days he hires helpers, whom he pays a daily wage, otherwise he wouldn't be able to complete his orders.

He likes his work, and for this he requires your help to purchase more raw material.

This is Eler's second loan with MFP. He is thankful for the trust and says that he will be timely with the loan repayments.

He will invest the 1000 soles in the purchase of metal sheets to build doors and windows and to repair other objects.

loans.use: to purchase metal sheets to build doors and windows

loans.name: Arquimedes

texts.es:
Arquimedes, de 50 años, es un hombre amable bueno y emprendedor, es conviviente con María quien es sus socia en su actividad economica.  Tiene 05 hijos los cuales ya son independientes se sienten muy contentos ya que les brindaron una buena calidad de vive. Viven juntos en su casa propia. Arquimedes, todos los días va muy temprano a a ordenar su local en una mercado mayorista de la ciudad, ahí vende yuca. Consigue estos productos de los mayoristas quienes traen de distintas chacras. Lleva realizando este negocio por 10 años y lo hace junto a su conviviente con quien comparte las ganancias.
Durante este tiempo vio la manera de cómo aumentar sus ingresos, es así que vende comida en su mismo puesto. Estas dos actividades le brindan buenos ingresos diariamente y con ello puede pagar algunas necesidades de su hogar. Espera seguir trabajando para hacer crecer aun mas su negocio y en el futuro poner una tienda de abarrotes en su casa. Este será su crédito número 15 con MFP, por ello espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete a ser un cliente responsable y puntual para no quedar mal con el banco comunal que le esta dando la confianza que necesitaba, además espera acoplarse muy rápidamente y contagiarse del espíritu colaborador y solidarios de todos. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará sacos de yucas al por mayor, para venderlo al menudeo, además comprará ingrediente e insumos para seguir vendiendo comida.
texts.en:
Fifty-year old Arquimedes is a good, friendly and enterprising man.  He lives with María, who is his business partner.  He has 5 children, who are already independent and are very happy since they were given a good quality of life.  They live together in their own home.

Everyday, Arquimedes goes very early to get everything ready to open his store in the city's wholesale market.  There he patiently waits for his customers to come looking for regional products, according to the season.  Right now, he is working with sacks of yucca.  He gets these products from wholesalers who bring them from their various farms.

He has been in this business for 10 years, and he does it with his partner, with whom he shares his earnings.  During this time, he saw a way to increase his income, so at the same time that he sells bananas, he also sells food in the same stall.  These two activities bring him good income, and with it he can buy what he needs and pay for household expenses.  

He hopes to continue working to grow his business even more, and in the future open a grocery store in his house.  

This will be his 15th loan with MFP, and he hopes for their cooperation so that he can continue achieving his goals.  On the other hand, he is committed to being a responsible and punctual client, so that he doesn't give a bad impression to the communal bank that is giving him the assurance that he needs.  Furthermore, he hopes to adapt very quickly and pick up on everyone's collaborative and supportive spirit.

With the requested amount of 1500 soles, he will buy sacks of yucca wholesale and sell them at retail.  He will also buy the ingredients and supplies to continue selling food at his market stall.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale yucca for re-sale, and to purchase ingredients for making and selling food

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa sells coat (a local meat used in stews and a variety of rice dishes). Adjoa sells coat in Bremawg near Abura, where she lives with her husband and six children. Her husband is a driver in the area. Adjoa has received no formal education. Adjoa has been selling coat for sometime now. She is responsible for assisting her husband with the general expenses of their family. Her loan will be used to buy more coat to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to increase her capital base to be able to buy more coat.

loans.use: to buy more coat (meat) to sell.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is married and has five children. She has received no formal education. Adjoa sells meat pies, bread and other food stuffs in Bremawg near Abura, which she has done for many years now. Her husband is a farmer. Adjoa uses her income to help pay her children’s school fees. Adjoa will use the loan to purchase more ingredients to make her meat pies and bread for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to improve her meat pie business to meet the local demand.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to make her meat pies and bread for sale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua sells bananas in Bremawg near Abura. Efua has received no formal education.  She is single and has four children. Efua has been selling bananas for several years now. She is responsible for supporting herself and her children alone. Her loan will be used to buy a larger quantity of bananas for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her banana selling business and possibly increase the variety of fruits she sells in the future.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of bananas for sale.

loans.name: Porfiria

texts.en: Porfiria is pictured on the left next to her husband with her brother-in-law on the right. She and her family are small farmers with deep respect for their environment. They understand that we need to do a better job reducing our impact because they perceive the changes in weather patterns in their region. They are also early adopters of new technologies to improve their farm. As a result, they are investing in a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester. They will use the waste from their pigs and chickens to produce renewable biogas, reducing their LP gas use, and will apply the organic fertilizer generated by the system on their crops. This loan represents 43% of the total cost of Porfiria's Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: To purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: María Joaquina

texts.en: María Joaquina (pictured with her husband), a grain farmer from Tlaxcala, is interested in transforming her animal waste into resources. She is investing in her 8 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester because she hopes to use the waste from her pigs and sheep to generate her own clean, renewable energy and organic fertilizer for use on her maize, wheat, and barley crops. By purchasing this system, she hopes to replace the expensive and non-renewable LP gas her family currently uses to cook and heat bathwater. This Kiva loan represents 56% of the total cost of her Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: To purchase an 8 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to perform maintenance on her two mototaxis.

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es:
Don Miguel tiene 62 años de edad, es casado y tiene seis hijos. Desde muy pequeño, se dedica a realizar trabajos agrícolas junto a su padre y hermanos. A los 19 años de edad, se caso y empezó a trabajar por su propia cuenta. Después, se dedico a trabajar con ganado y su esposa e hijos le ayudan. Para comprar los insumos agrícolas, debe viajar a una distancia de tres kilómetros desde su casa hasta el lugar en donde aborda un vehiculo que lo conduce al lugar en donde realiza sus compras. Después, debe de trasladar los insumos hasta el terreno donde tiene sus cultivos, debe pagar un carretero para que se los lleve. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para completar el dinero para comprar dos bueyes. Con la inversión ya no tendrá que pagar para que le trasladen los insumos al terreno sino que él mismo lo hará con sus bueyes. Su deseo, es brindarles el estudio a sus hijos menores y trabajar en compañía de sus hijos mayores.
texts.en:
Miguel is 62 years old, married, and has six children. Since he was very little, he did agricultural work together with his father and brothers. At the age of 19, he got married and began working on his own. Then he worked with livestock and his wife and children helped him. In order to buy agricultural supplies, he must travel a distance of 3 kilometers from his house until reaching a place where he boards a vehicle that takes him to the site where he makes his purchases. After that, he must move the supplies to the field where he has his crops. He has to pay a cart driver to transport them. 

The loan that he is requesting from Fundación Campo is to complete the balance of the money needed to buy two oxen. With this investment, he will no longer have to pay for the transport of agricultural supplies to his field, but instead will be able to do it himself with his oxen. His wish to is provide his younger children with an education and work in the company of his older children.

loans.use: to buy two oxen.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Kuña guapa significa mujer trabajadora, y es eso lo que son estas 14 mujeres que forman este grupo, están en su tercer ciclo, y gracias a que todas están ayudándose las unas a las otras es que están saliendo adelante.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Cristina, quien se dedica a la venta de chipas (Alimento típico paraguayo hecho a base de almidón) y cuenta que recorre todos los días muchos kilómetros para poder vender su producto, y que gracias a este trabajo da a su familia un poco de lo que necesitan. Se define a si misma como una persona muy trabajadora, que tiene muchos sueños que quiere cumplir.
Solicita de este crédito para poder comprar chipas, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir vendiendo y teniendo las ganancias para seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
"Kuña guapa" means hard-working woman, and that is what the four women who make up this group are. They are in their third loan cycle, and thanks to the fact that they are helping one another, they are succeeding. 

One of the members of the group is Cristina, who sells chipas (a traditional Paraguayan treat made from manioc flour). She says that she travels many kilometers a day to be able to sell her product, and that thanks to this work she gives her family a bit of what they need.  She describes herself as a very hard-working person, who has many dreams she wants to fulfill.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy chipas, as that way she will be able to keep selling them and have the earnings to continue helping her family.

loans.use: To buy chipas to sell (chipas are a traditional Paraguayan treat made from manioc flour).

loans.name: Yvrose

texts.en: Yvrose lives in Port Salut, Haiti, about a 5-hour drive from the capital Port-au-Prince. She already has a business selling mobile phones and phone credit. She is now hoping to expand her business by becoming an EarthSpark Clean Energy Entreprenuer. With a Kiva loan, Yvrose will be set up with a “Business in a Bag”, a kit containing a personalized mix of small-scale clean energy products, marketing materials and training on energy literacy, SMS tracking of sales, and basic business skills. A 400 dollar loan will allow her to start selling solar desk lamps and charcoal efficient stoves. She would like to sell EarthSpark products so that the people in her community can benefit from the products and help ameliorate the economic and environmental problems in her country.

loans.use: inventory for a clean energy business

loans.name: Las Guadalupanas Group

texts.es: Doña Socorro tiene 39 años de edad, desde hace mas de 10 años se dedica la cría y venta de pescado (trucha arcoiris) ya que tiene en su casa un estanque donde las cría y las alimenta, dice que llega a medir de 40 a 60 centímetros y llegan a pesar hasta 500 o mas gramos, platica también que les dan un alimento llamado “pellet” el cual está compuesto de harina de pescado, y se les da una o dos veces al día y se venden cuando tienen una edad entre 4 o 5 meses. Dice que es un pez hábil y fuerte,  su carne tiene alto valor nutritivo y es muy higiénica por que no puede vivir en aguas sucias por que se mueren y a donde va a venderlas es en la población de zitácuaro en un estanque que tiene acondicionado en una camioneta. Dice que está pidiendo un crédito ahorita por que quiere comprar alimento y quiere hacer otro estanque para que estén en mejores condiciones. Dice que en el mes que vende mas es en los meses de marzo y abril. Ella espera que con el crédito tenga en mejores condiciones a sus peces. Las otras cuatro integrantes del grupo se llaman Marisol, Remedios, Felipa y Claudia ellas invertirán en artículos para tienda de abarrotes,  para compra y venta de guajolotes.
texts.en:
Socorro is 39 years old.  She has been raising and selling fish (rainbow trout) for over ten years.  She has a pond at her house where she raises and feeds them.  She says that they come to measure 40 to 60 centimeters, and they come to weigh as much as 500 grams or more.  She also says that she gives them food called “pellet”, which is comprised of flour and fish.  She feeds them one or two times a day.  She sells them when they are between four and five months old.  

She says that it is a nice, strong fish, and its meat is very nutritious.  It is also very hygienic because it is not able to live in dirty waters or it will die.  She goes to the town of Zitácuaro to sell them.  She takes them in a tank that she has set up in a truck.

She says that she is requesting the loan now because she wants to buy food.  She also wants to make another pond so that they are in a better environment.  She says she sells the most in the months of March and April.  She hopes that with the loan her fish will have a better environment.

The names of the other four members of the group are Marisol, Remedios, Felipa, and Claudia.  They will use the loan to buy items for a grocery store and to buy and sell turkeys.

loans.use: to buy material to make a fish tank and to buy fish food.

loans.name: Remigia

texts.es:
La Sra. Remigia es de la ciudad de Encarnación, es una persona muy trabajadora, que desde siempre ha trabajo y luchado por sus metas y objetivos.
Es dueña de una despensa en el centro de Encarnación ya hace más de 3 años, y comenta que se ha hecho de muy buen nombre en ese barrio y que gracias a eso ya tiene muy buena clientela. Ella se define a sí misma como una persona que se esfuerza siempre al máximo por lo que quiere.
Remigia solicita de este crédito para la compra de tomates, locotes, cebollas, pollo, arroz, mandioca y demás productos para poder surtir su local y tener buenos productos para ofrecer a sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo que la ayudará mucho.
texts.en: Remigia is from the city of Encarnación; she’s a very hardworking person who has always worked and striven to reach her goals and objectives.  She owns a grocery store in downtown Encarnación; she’s had it for more than three years and comments that it’s attained good renown in the neighborhood and thanks to that she has a good clientele.  She defines herself as a person who always strives to the maximum to attain what she wants.  Remigia is asking for this loan to buy tomatoes, peppers, onions, chicken, rice, manioc and other products to stock her store and have good products to offer her customers.  She is grateful for this opportunity she’s getting that will help her very much.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, peppers, onions, chicken, rice, manioc and others.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul lives in the Muranga area of Kenya, which produces coffee for export. He has four children and has been farming for five years.  His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, and crops.

He stated that what is most enjoyable about farming is the income which enables him to cater to the family's needs. He says his biggest challenge is lack of market for the products. One of the animals in the farm is named Sophia.

Paul was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied, "Because the loan terms are favourable in terms of interest." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session. He responded, "Microfinance is for small scale enterprises."

His highest monthly expense is family expenses. When asked how the loan would benefit his family, Paul replied, "I will be able to pay school fees for my children."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Paul owns a cow and poultry but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower currently has mosquito netting in the household but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Blanca Luz

texts.es:
Blanca es una mujer de 49 años, creció en una familia de escasos recursos en la cual consiguió el apoyo para terminar la escuela primaria, trabajó ayudando a sus padres desde muy joven y se casó ilusionada, sin embargo su matrimonio no resultó como ella esperaba por lo que ahora está separada y tiene 3 hijos  que son independientes y cada uno tiene su vida definida. Para Blanca el mayor obstáculo que atravesó fue la separación de su esposo, pues ella tuvo que buscar el sustento para ella y sus hijos en medio del dolor, lo cual fue posible gracias al espíritu emprendedor de ella. Actualmente vive sola en la Parroquia de Bomobolí de Santo Domingo, la capital de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, una provincia de Ecuador que en los últimos años ha tenido un alto crecimiento sostenido. Su capital  es una ciudad en donde lo más atractivo y llamativo son sus deliciosas frutas, y la gastronomía que ofrecen en el lugar. También cuenta con un comercio considerable  ya que se ha convertido en un puerto terrestre de intercambio comercial entre las regiones Sierra y Costa del país. Además cuenta con varios atractivos turísticos que acompañados de su clima cálido son muy concurridos por turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Es por esto que la mayoría de sus habitantes han emprendido con alguna actividad comercial o de servicios para habitantes y turistas.
Blanca se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de manera ambulante desde hace 8 años, actividad que desarrolló gracias a la recomendación de una gran amiga que le acompañó a inscribirse como consultora de belleza. Cada día visita clientes en su mayoría mujeres para asesorarles sobre los productos que necesitan, además paralelamente en su casa tiene algunos pollos que alimenta y cuida para su posterior venta. Blanca está solicitando un préstamo para comprar mercadería que pueda vender a precios competitivos a sus clientes, pues si compra mayor cantidad de productos, mayor será el descuento que reciba y además puede tener los productos en stock para atender inmediatamente las solicitudes de sus clientes. Blanca espera que este incremento en sus ingresos pueda mejorar su calidad de vida y así abastecer sus necesidades de salud, alimentación, vestimenta en el futuro. Blanca agradece a Fundación Alternativa por el apoyo que le han brindado ya que para ella no ha sido fácil invertir en su negocio, justamente por la falta de capital.
texts.en:
Blanca’s a 49-year-old woman who grew up in a family of scarce economic resources but that was able to support her schooling through elementary school level.  She worked helping her parents from a very young age and married with much hope.  However, her marriage did not turn out like she expected and she’s now separated.  She has three children who are now independent and each has their life clearly defined.

Blanca’s separation from her husband was the greatest obstacle she’s faced because she had to find a way to support herself and her children amidst the pain which she did thanks to her great entrepreneurial spirit.  She currently lives alone in Bomobolí Parish in Santo Domingo, the capital of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas Province, a province in Ecuador that’s undergone sustained growth in the last few years.  Its capital is a city whose most noteworthy and attractive feature is its delicious fruit and the local cuisine.  It also has considerable commerce because it’s become a land port for commercial exchange between the country’s mountain and coastal regions.  It also has several tourist attractions that accompanied by its warm climate draw many national and foreign tourists.  Because of this, most of its inhabitants carry out activities that are commercial or service oriented for residents and tourists.

Blanca has been working selling cosmetics from place to place for the last 8 years, an activity she developed thanks to a recommendation from a great girlfriend of hers who accompanied her to sign up as a beauty consultant.  She visits her customers, for the most part women, every day to advise them about the products they need.  In addition, she also has chickens at home that she feeds and cares for to sell subsequently.

Blanca is asking for this loan to buy merchandise she can sell at competitive prices to her customers because if she buys them in large amounts the discount she gets will be larger and she can have all the products in stock to fill customer orders immediately.  Blanca hopes that this increase in her income will allow her to improve her quality of life and meet her future health, food and clothing needs.  Blanca thanks Fundación Alternativa for the support they've given her because it’s not been easy for her to invest in her business precisely because of this lack of capital.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to increase sales.

loans.name: Grupo De Amigas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo llamado grupo de Amigas está en su noveno ciclo. Están ayudándose para poder salir adelante. Vieron una gran oportunidad de crecimiento en el programa de la fundación.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Gloria, ella tiene como actividad la venta de zapatos, y siempre esta cargada de mucho trabajo. Se ha hecho de muy buena clientela, ya que siempre tiene buena calidad de calzados y a bajo costo, lo cual le ayuda.
El sueño de Gloria es poder tener una gran tienda de zapatos donde podrá tener todo tipo de ellos y poder ofrecer gran variedad a sus clientes, es en miras a cumplir con su sueño que pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de mas calzados para venderlos, y así estar más cerca de su sueño. Agradece por la oportunidad que ella y sus compañeras de grupo reciben para poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
This group called “Grupo de Amigas” (Group of Girlfriends) is in its 9th cycle.  They are helping each other to move forward.  They saw a great growth opportunity in the Fundación’s program.  

One of the members of the group is Gloria.  Her activity is selling shoes and she always has a lot of work to do.  She’s secured a good clientele because she always has good quality shoes at low cost which is a help.

Gloria’s dream is to be able to have a shoe store to stock all types of shoes and offer a wide variety to her customers.  Aiming at reaching this dream, she’s asking for this loan to buy more shoes to sell and thus be closer to her dream.  She is very grateful for the opportunity she and her fellow members are getting to be able to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la ciudad de Encarnación surgió por promociones realizadas en la zona, se encuentran  en el 10º ciclo,  y quieren poder ir hasta el máximo nivel del programa para ir creciendo y aprovechando de las capacitaciones que las ayudan mucho, 
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Pablina ella se dedica a la venta de ropa ambulante, tiene su puesto donde vende todo tipo de prendas y es así como ayuda a su familia dándoles lo que necesitan. Cuenta la Sra. Pablina  que el crédito que solicita a la Fundación lo utilizará para la compra de prendas de todo tipo para volver a vender y así seguir ayudando a su familia como lo viene haciendo. Ella se encuentra  muy agradecida ya que gracias a los ciclos anteriores pudo mejorar sus ingresos y el de su familia.
texts.en:
This group from the city of Encarnación sprouted from the advancements made in the area. They are in their tenth loan cycle and they want to go to the highest level of the program in order to continue growing and taking advantage of the capitations that help them very much. 
One of the members of the group is Pablina who sells clothing as a street vendor. She has her stand where she sells all types of garments and in this way is able to help her family by giving them what they need. Pablina says that the loan that she is requesting from the foundation will be used to buy garments of all types to resell, and in this way, continue helping her family as she has been doing. She is very grateful since, thanks to the previous loans, she manged to increase her income and that of her family's.

loans.use: to buy garments to sell.

loans.name: Enma

texts.es:
Enma tiene 47 años, está casada con Glicer con quien tiene 2 hijos de 18 y 11 años. Ella y su familia viven en una casa alquilada en un distrito rural. La creatividad y la constancia son unas de sus virtudes, por ello Enma se dedica a la confección y tejidos de chompas, gorras, chalinas, ponchos, etc. Todo lo que produce lo ofrece a los turistas nacionales e internacionales que llegan a su distrito, para ello cuenta con un puesto de ventas ubicado en el centro cívico.
Al lado de su esposo realiza ésta actividad, ya que él permanece más tiempo con los telares confeccionando alfombras y tapices. Con este trabajo coordinado, Enma puede brindarles a sus hijos una educación decente y calidad de vida mejor. “Me siento orgullosa porque todo lo que tengo lo obtuve a base de esfuerzo en casi 20 años”, menciona. 
Ahora viaja constantemente hacia la ciudad de Lima, llevando sus productos al por mayor, para esto tuvo que contactarse con personas quienes le hacen pedidos en cada campaña.
Enma requiere de su ayuda para adquirir más mercaderías y continuar en su lucha hacia el emprendimiento. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres al Futuro” y éste es su crédito número 6 con MFP, dice que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas como en ocasiones anteriores. Dice sentirse cómoda trabajando con las socias de su banco comunal porque comparten los mismos intereses.
Enma destinará los 500 soles solicitados en la compra de materiales para elaborar sus tejidos como lanas sintéticas y de ovejas y alpacas, además de otras artesanías para surtir su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Enma, 47, is married to Glicer with whom she has two children who are 18 and 11 years old.  She and her family live in a rented house in a rural district.  Creativity and constancy are some of her virtues which is why Enma works sewing and knitting sweaters, caps, shawls, ponchos, etc.  Everything she makes she sells to national and international tourists that come to her district and to do so she has a stand located in the civic center.

She carries out her activity alongside her husband since he spends more time with the looms making rugs and tapestries.  With this coordinated work, Enma is able to provide her children with a decent education and better quality of life.  “I feel proud because everything I own I’ve gotten as a result of almost 20 years of effort,” she mentions.  Now, she travels constantly to the city of Lima to sell her products at wholesale.  To do so, she had to contact people who place orders every season.

Enma needs your help to acquire more merchandise and continue her struggle toward empowerment.  She belongs to the “Mujeres al Futuro” (Women towards the Future) communal bank and this is her MFP loan #6.  She says she’ll be punctual with her installment payments like she’s been previously.  She says she feels comfortable working with her fellow communal bank members because they share the same interests.

Enma will use the requested 500 soles to buy knitting materials like synthetic wool and alpaca wool in addition to other crafts to stock her sales stand.

loans.use: to buy supplies like synthetic wool and other crafts.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia tiene 33 años esta casada con Edwin con quien tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 9 años. Ella y su familia viven en una casa propia ubicada en un distrito rural.
Silvia es una mujer acogedora y empeñosa. Se dedica a la artesanía hace más de 15 años. 
Ella tiene gran destreza en los tejidos. Desde niña tejía la ropa de sus muñecas, ahora que tiene una responsabilidad familiar, convirtió su pasatiempo como principal medio para adquirir ingresos. Ahora cuenta con telares, con ellos elabora mantas y tapices de diversas lanas. “Es más rentable tejer con lana de alpaca pero también es arriesgado porque se invierte mucho”, menciona.
A la vez, ella y su esposo se dedican a la agricultura, con la producción de maca, cuyas ventas son favorables. Ellos dividen los roles, Silvia en los tejidos y Edwin en los cultivos, así piensan lograr sus objetivos, uno de ellos es terminar de construir su casa. 
Sus metas se enfocan en crecer como empresaria, por ello requiere de su apoyo para adquirir más materiales.
Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres al futuro” y éste es su crédito número 4 con MFP, como en anteriores ocasiones menciona que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Se siente a gusto de trabajar con socias responsables.
Silvia destinará los 1000 soles en la compra de varios kilos de lanas de oveja y alpaca. Así también comprará hilos sintéticos de varios colores.
texts.en:
Silvia, 33, is married to Edwin with whom she has two children who are 14 and 9 years old.  She and her family live in a house of their own in a rural district.  Silvia’s a welcoming and enterprising woman.  She’s been a crafts-person for more than 15 years.

She’s very skilled at knitting.  When she was a little girl she’d knit clothes for dolls and now that she has family responsibility she turned her hobby into her main source of income.  Now, she has looms that she uses to make blankets and tapestries out of different kinds of wool.  “It’s more profitable to knit with alpaca wool but it’s also riskier because one must invest more,” she mentions.

She and her husband also work in agriculture growing ‘maca’ [an Andean root vegetable] which sells well.  They divide roles: Silvia knits and Edwin farms.  They hope to reach their objectives this way and one of them is to finish building their house.  Her goals focus on developing as a businesswoman but to do so she needs your help in order to acquire more materials.

She belongs to the “Mujeres al Futuro” (Women towards the Future) communal bank and this is her MFP loan #4.  Like in previous occasions, she mentions that she’ll be punctual with her installment payments.  She feels good working with responsible members.  Silvia will use the 1,000 soles to buy several kilos of sheep and alpaca wool and will also buy synthetic thread in assorted colors.

loans.use: to buy several kilos of sheep and alpaca wool as well as synthetic thread in assorted colors.

loans.name: Porvenir 2 Group

texts.es:
El comité Porvenir II  es de San Lorenzo, y tiene 15 miembros, que se unieron para ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo en conjunto de todas.
La Sra. Miguela, es casada tiene 35 años, es una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora y por sobre todo muy optimista e inculca a sus amigas de su comité a salir adelante. Ella vende remedios yuyos (remedios naturales), y aunque su trabajo sea muy humilde está orgullosa de lo que hace ya que es muy honesto.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de remedios yuyos para poder vender y seguir ayudando a su familia con su digno trabajo.
texts.en:
The “Porvenir II” (Time to Come II) committee is from San Lorenzo and has 15 members who joined together to help their families by means of their teamwork.  Miguela, 35, is married and she’s an enterprising, hardworking woman who above all is very optimistic and encourages her girlfriends in the committee to get ahead.  

She sells ‘yuyo’ remedies (natural remedies) and although her work is very humble she’s proud of what she does because it’s very honest.  She’s requesting this loan to buy yuyo remedies to sell and continue to help her family by means of her proper work.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina de 53 años, una madre caracterizada por su amplio espíritu de trabajo comparte una vida conyugal con Amadeo de 57 años con quien tiene el orgullo de tener 5 hijos.
Habitan una vivienda construida a base de Material noble construida de a pocos. Dedicada por muchos años a las actividades agrícolas optó por incursionar en el negocio de la venta de abarrotes con motivo de hallarse cerca de sus hijos quienes la apoyan con las tareas del negocio todo el tiempo.
Al observar la ausencia de este tipo de comercio se inicio con mucho ímpetu cumpliéndose casi 10 años desde su apertura en un ambiente cómodo del primero piso de su vivienda.
Se siente muy contenta por como desempeña su negocio logrando conocer amistades y convirtiéndose en una vecina muy conocida. 
Con motivo de reabastecer su negocio desea adquirir productos de mayor demanda con su compra al por mayor ya que de esta manera espera hallar mejores precios a medida que mantiene su negocio abastecido por un periodo mas prolongado.
Desea a futuro Culminar el segundo piso de su vivienda y posteriormente realizar el alquiler de habitaciones para mejorar su economía familiar. Desea contar con 3,000 nuevos soles para abastecer su negocio con sacos de arroz, azúcar, conservas de pescado y demás verduras.
texts.en: Marina is a 53-year-old mother with a great work ethic. She lives with her common-law husband Amadeo, with whom she shares the pride of having five children. They live in a home built of of bricks. After working for many years in farming, she opted to go into business selling groceries so that she could be closer to her children, who support her full-time in her business. She noticed that there was a need for such a business ten years ago, and she took a great deal of initiative to get it started. Her store has a comfortable ambiance and is located on the first floor of her home. She is very satisfied since in running her business she has managed to make friends and to become very well-known in the area. She wishes to re-supply her business and buy products at wholesale that are in high demand by her customers. This will allow her to obtain better prices and to keep her business going. In the future she wants to complete the second floor of her home and thus be able to rent out rooms so that she can improve her family's economic conditions. She needs 3,000 nuevos soles in order to supply her business with sacks of flour, rice, sugar and other items.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sugar, dried fish and other grocery items.

loans.name: Rosalvina

texts.es:
Rosalvina tiene 56 años, comparte actualmente una vida marital con Juan de 53 años , tienen el orgullo de haber instruido a sus hijos por el buen camino y lograr que sean personas de bien.
Es propietaria de una vivienda construida a base de material noble. Dedicada a actividades diversas al igual que su esposo lograron culminar la habilitación de su vivienda en donde actualmente desempeñan su negocio consistente en una tienda de abarrotes.
Llevan casi 9 años de trabajo en conjunto con el cual lograron brindarles a sus hijos una educación de calidad.
Para mejorar sus ingresos optaron por complementar su negocio con el servicio de recargas para celulares.
Se siente contenta con su negocio puesto que pasa casi todo el tiempo al lado de su esposo y juntos pueden así tomar decisiones para beneficio de su economía familiar.
Como el negocio de abarrotes requiere constante abastecimiento e inversión en diversos productos desean adquirir mercadería al por mayor de viveres no perecibles para el cual desean acceder a un crédito con el apoyo de su  entidad financiera.
Sus planes a futuro apuntan a realizar la construcción de su vivienda con la culminación del segundo piso con el objetivo de dedicarse al alquiler de habitaciones. Desean contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería al por mayor como arroz, azúcar entre otros.
texts.en:
Rosalvina, 56, shares her married life with Juan, 53.  They are proud to have led their children along a good path and succeeded in their becoming upstanding citizens.  She owns a house built of substantial materials.  She and her husband carry out a variety of activities and they succeeded in building their home where they currently carry out a sustainable business: a grocery store.  They've been in this business together for almost 9 years and were able through it to provide a quality education for their children.  To improve their income they decided to add mobile phone recharge services to their business.  She feels happy with her business because she spends almost all her time alongside her husband and together they can make decisions that benefit the family economy.

Since the grocery business requires constant resupplying and investing in various products, they want to buy foodstuffs and non-perishable items at wholesale and to do so want to access a loan with help from your financial institution.  Her future plans point towards home construction and the completion of a second story so they can start a room rental business.  They need 1,000 new soles to buy merchandise alike rice and sugar, among others at wholesale.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like rice and sugar among others at wholesale.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 33 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Él trabaja la agricultura y la ganadería, vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos; uno tiene cinco años y el menor un año y medio. Carlos tiene seis años de trabajar con ganado, posee tres vacas las que producen leche y elaboran queso y sus derivados, produce un aproximado de 20 botellas de leche diario. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar tres cerdas embarazadas, medicinas y el concentrado necesario para terminar de crecerlas. En este negocio lleva tres años de experiencia y manifiesta que le deja muy buenas ganancias. Las cerdas las cuida su esposa mientras él se dedica a otras actividades, considera que dentro de unos tres meses esta vendiendo los cerdos. Su próximo, reto es comprar siete cerdos para engordarlos.
texts.en:
Carlos, 33, is married and has two children.  He works in agriculture and animal husbandry.  He lives with his wife and two children; one of them is 5-years-old and the younger one is a year-and-a-half.  Carlos has worked with livestock for six years.  He has three cows that produce milk and he makes cheese and its derivatives; he produces approximately 20 bottles of milk daily.

The loan he’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy three pregnant sows, medicine and feed concentrate needed to finish raising them.  He’s been in this business three years and states that it yields good profits.  His wife will care for the sows while he does other activities.  He believes that in about three months he’ll be selling the pigs.  His next challenge is to buy seven pigs to fatten up.

loans.use: to buy three pregnant sows, medicine and feed.

loans.name: Ton

texts.en:
Ton is one of the few pioneering Mlabri men who have learned how to weave hammocks and he is a remarkably skilled weaver, among his many talents. 

While Mr. Ton was one of the first of the Yellow Leaf people to become comfortable among other groups, he is proud to have stayed among his own tribe and is recognized as a leader within the village. 

He holds a unique position within the Mlabri community- while many Mlabri are shy and reclusive, he is a communications specialist! As a young man, he spent many years working for local Northern Thai villagers and developed an enviable fluency in Thai. He is often a spokesperson and “go-between” for the Mlabri and neighboring communities. 

He has pursued many new opportunities in order to provide for his family, which he believes is an important duty for a husband and father. 

With this loan, he will be able to provide stability and security throughout the coming year.

loans.use: to create a stockpile of hammocks during the off season to ensure a steady flow of income throughout the year.

loans.name: Mamas Solteras Group

texts.es:
El Comite MAMAS SOLTERAS  esta en el segundo ciclo, donde las miembros están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas y a ayudarse para poder salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias.
La  Sra. Antolina vende Carbon, y cuenta que le esta yendo muy bien en su venta, ya que se esta usando mayormente el carbón que el gas, entonces tiene cada vez mejores ventas.
Antolina a mas de ser una persona muy trabajadora tiene un gran espíritu y quiere salir adelante  y con el credito que solicita tiene la intención de poder comprar carbón en cantidad y proveer a sus vecinos que tienen despensas para re vender y asi ella crecer mas en  su negocio y superarse a si misma.
texts.en:
The committee MAMAS SOLTERAS (Single Mothers) is in its second cycle.  The members are learning to work together and help each other to get ahead and help their families.

Antolina sells coal, and she says that her sales are going very well.  Since coal is being used more than gas, she has more and more sales.  In addition to being a very hardworking person, Antolina has a great spirit and wants to get ahead.  With the loan she is requesting she plans to be able to buy coal in quantity and offer it to her neighbors who have storage for it and thus grow her business and outdo herself.

loans.use: to buy coal to sell.

loans.name: Santa

texts.es:
Santa de 36 años lleva una vida independiente y de trabajo junto a sus 3 hijos, por quienes apuesta hasta lo imposible.
Reside junto a sus retoños en una vivienda de material noble que logró culminar gracias a su ex compromiso. Al sufrir la separación de su pareja optó por incursionar en diversos empleos logrando hasta hoy desempeñarse como vendedora de carteras y otros afines. Lleva 4 meses con el negocio para el cual encontró en ella una buena capacidad para las ventas.
Se siente muy a gusto con su trabajo ya que de esta manera ha logrado entablar muchas amistades quienes son sus constantes clientas y han demostrado puntualidad en el pago de los productos a crédito que ella ofrece.
Todos los días ofrece sus productos recorriendo la ciudad y visitando constantemente a sus clientas.
A manera de ampliar su stock desea contar con capital y por ello desea acudir a su entidad financiera para adquirir otro lote de carteras.
Todo el trabajo realizado según comenta es para brindarle a sus pequeños una mejor educación para quienes ofrece todo su sacrificio. Desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de un lote de carteras con los modelos mas variados solicitado por sus clientas.
texts.en:
Santa, 36, lives an independent life working.  She will do even the impossible for her three children.  She lives with her children in a house made of substantial building materials that she managed to finish thanks to her ex-spouse.
