Lali requested a loan to sell clothing. She plans to purchase clothing in Turkey and then resell it in her village. This will increase the income of her family. With increased income, they will be able to improve their living conditions. Lali awaits your support.

loans.use: to sell clothing

loans.name: Qayum

texts.ru: Каюм - житель Б.Гафуровского района города Худжанд. Ему 66 лет. Образование среднее. Каюм вот уже 8 лет со своей семьей занимается животноводством. Они покупают крупно-рогатый скот, несколько месяцев выхаживают и затем продают его на рынке с наценкой. Чтобы расширить свой бизнес, Каюм берет кредит для приобретения телят.
texts.en: Qayum is a resident of the B. Gafurovsky naighborhood in the city of Khujand.  He is 66 years old.  He has a high school education.  Qayum and his family have been raising livestock for 8 years now.  They buy large livestock, take care of it for several month and then sell it at the market at a premium.  In order to grow his business Qayum is taking out a loan to purchase calves.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Hasrat

texts.en:
Hasrat is a 35-year-old trader, married with two children. He has been selling mobile phones and accessories for the last five years. His shop is located in a central bazaar. This business brings in a stable income of 120 AZN, however this is very low to cover family needs.  

Hazrat applied for 1700 AZN to buy more mobile phones to cover the demand of current and potential customers.  This will be his second loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy more mobile phones for his shop

loans.name: Phylis

texts.en:
Phylis is aged thirty-eight and a farmer in Kitale county in Kenya where she lives with her husband and two children who are both schooling. She has been in farming for the past fifteen years, producing milk, horticultural products and poultry products which she sells at the local market in her area. She runs a green grocery shop as an additional source of income.

She is requesting a 41,600 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow that will give her more milk and earn her extra income to uplift her living standards. She can use some of the money to educate her children. In the next five years, she aspires to buy a quality dairy cow that produces fifteen litres of milk per day. 

Diseases, the high cost of feed, and inadequate capital are her major challenges in farming.

She is grateful to Juhudi kilimo for giving her the loan.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en:
Rovshan is a 42-year-old man. He is married and has two children. He sells  seasonal fruit such as pears, oranges, apples, pomegranates and bananas. He has 15 years of experience and the reason to start his business was poor living conditions and a low pension.  

Fruit is very popular among Azerbaijan people and in high demand during the year.  People like to eat it fresh and this is one of the main desserts for guests. His shop is located in a center bazaar and people always pass his shop and come to buy some fresh fruit. His monthly income from this business is 180 AZN. Rovshan's brother helps him to sell fruit.

Rovshan wants to expand his business. The amount of products he sells is not enough to cover the high demand. He would like to purchase more fruit and vegetables and increase his turnover as well as improve the life of his family. For this purpose he applied for a 1000 AZN loan.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables to increase his income

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam used her previous loan to buy clothes to sell. She is a 39-year-old single mother with three children living in Kasese, Uganda .She has been selling clothes for two years and this has enabled her to provide the necessities to her children, as she has sole responsibility for taking care of them. Her hardship is inadequate capital to meet the high demand. Her personal goal is to educate her children and her business goal is to expand her business to new markets. Mariam intends to use the money to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Korpo

texts.en:
Korpo lives in Montserrado County near the capital city of Liberia. It is well known as the commercial city of Liberia.  She is 38 years old and married with three children between 2 and 17 years old. They all live at home and the children are in school.

For the past years now she has been running a table market where she sells charcoal.  She started this business with help from her father and learned this way of selling from her mother.  She likes her business because it gives her more profits and makes her popular.

She is requesting a loan to buy more charcoal for her business.  She wants to get more money to build her house since she has a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru:
Саодат 47 лет. Она живет в Шахритусском районе. Она замужем. У нее большая семья - у нее пятеро детей. Двое ее сыновья находятся за рубежом. 
В течение 5 лет Саодат занимается животноводством. Она покупает скот, разводит их и затем продает с наценкой. Саодат берет кредит для закупа скота. А после его продажи с полученной прибыли сделать ремонт в доме.
texts.en: Saodat is 47 years old.  She lives in the Shahrituz area.  She is married.  She has a large family - she has five children.  Two of her sons are abroad.  Saodat has been raising livestock for 5 years.  She purchases livestock, raises it and then sells it at a premium.  Saodat is taking out a loan to purchase livestock.  After selling it she will use the profits to make repairs to her home.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Sainakul

texts.ru: Сайнакул 50 лет, замужем, воспитала 6 детей. Будучи активным человеком, Сайнакул смогла дать образование своим детям. Младшая дочка учится в местном медицинском колледже. Младший сын учится  в школе. В качестве источника финансирования для ее семьи, Сайнакул с 2000 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 15,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Сайнакул имеется 10 голов коров, 40 голов овец, 8 лошадей и 9 голов коз.  Выручка от перепродажи скота составляет около 55,000 сом в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сайнакул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 55,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы от кредита Сайнакул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Sainakul is 50 years old, she is married and raised 6 children.  Being an active person, Sainakul was able to give her children an education.  Her younger daughter is studying at the local medical college.  Her younger son is studying in school.  As a source of financial support for her family Sainakul has been raising livestock since the year 2000, having started this business with a sum of 15,000 som (KGS).  Today Sainakul's holdings include 10 cows, 40 sheep, 8 horses and 9 goats.  Her revenues from the sale of livestock are around 55,000 som per month.  In order to further grow her business Sainakul turned to "Bai-Tushum & Partners" for a loan of 55,0000 som (KGS) to purchase additional heads of livestock.  Sainakul plans to invest her profits from the loan to further increase her holdings.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for resale

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a 37-year-old hardworking married woman with 6 children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She operates a retail shop for shoes.  Her business is located along a busy street in her town and she started this business to help her support her children with school fees and other requirements.  She has a bigger market despite challenges of a small capital base and price fluctuations.  Her personal dream is to build a permanent house and also diversify her business to include first-hand clothes.  Margret intends to use the loan to buy children and adult footwear to sell.

loans.use: buy shoes to resell

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a 47-year-old businessman.   He is married and supports a family of four.  He runs a small milling business (posho mill) in the outskirts of town.  His wife earns additional income through her small-scale horticultural farming business.

Musa has been in this business for the past five years.  He has requested a loan of KES 25,000.  This is is second loan (the previous one was paid successfully) which he intends to purchase more maize and millet for milling.  

With the anticipated profit, Musa intends to use to purchase another milling machine. His hope and dream is to expand his business to a full-fledged milling company which can produce different products.

loans.use: buy maize and millet

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 38-year-old married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 6 years to 17 years. She describes herself to be an honest woman. 

Janet operates a food stall where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located within a rural area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the outbreak of diseases which affect fish hence they die before they are sold.  She will use this KES 10,000 loan to buy fish to sell.  Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy fish to sell

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en: Mwanamkuu is glad about her first loan. She was able to buy compact discs with recorded videos and other data material which she displayed as entertainment to her customers.  As a result, she obtained enough income to repay her loan on time.  She plans to repair seats and buy more video discs for the business. She is therefore applying for a loan of 41,850 to refurbish the venue and buy more videos to display. She looks forward to installing a play station and also to broadcast the premier league matches which are loved by the locals.

loans.use: refurbish site and buy videos for her business

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali lives in the Senaki District. She is 33 years old and lives with her husband, child and mother. Lali and her mother work at the local school as teachers and get small monthly salaries. 

Several times, Lali has requested loans from local credit providers for a family business start up, but her loan requests were always rejected because of the lack of experience in new business. Her current loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo.  The start-up loan program envisages the provision of credit on soft conditions to business start-ups and re-startups for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit, Lali will start up a fast-food café. She will bake cakes and pies and sell them among the local people. She will pay for inventories such as tables, chairs and a lunch counter. Lali hopes her business will be profitable and that she will attract many customers since there is no similar café nearby. The profit will be reinvested in the same business and Lali will be able to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: purchase inventories for her cafe

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 20 years to 23 years. She describes herself to be a bold and decisive woman. 

Josphine operates a grocery store  where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for 18 years. Her business is located within a busy market  and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of storage facilities for the vegetables and fruits.  She will use thus KES 20,000 loan to buy vegetables and fruits to resell. Her business goal is to export vegetables to East African areas within 5 years.

loans.use: buy vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Maarifa Group

texts.en:
Hamza, who is in his late 40s, is married and has three children who are in school. Hamza has been managine his family by running a charcoal selling business since 2010.  He works from 9am to 7pm daily and is able to earn a good profit monthly.

Hamza is requesting his first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he wants to use to increase more stock in his business to resell. His dream is to one day be able to give better and quality education to his children and maintain a better life.

Hamza will share this loan with his loan group "Maarifa" which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: buy charcoal to resell

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 50-year-old married woman. She has 4 children, with ages ranging from 15 to 27 years. She describes herself to be a focused woman.

She operates a tailoring retail store where she sells clothes that she makes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located within a strategic business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high price of clothing materials.

She will use the 10,000 KES loan to buy clothes material for making dresses. Her business goal is to buy more sewing machines and employ more people to her business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is a married woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 7 years to 23 years. She describes herself to be a humble and caring woman.  She operates a beauty salon where she provides hair services such as plaiting, blow-drying, etc. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located within a strategic business area and her primary customers are women from the nearby environs. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of modern equipment used on salon . She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a hair dryer which will increase the hair services to customers. Her business goal is to run a hair dressing business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer machine

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.es: Demetrio vive junto a su compañera de vida Margarita en casa propia; él se dedica a la compra y venta de verduras tomates, chiles, cebollas entre otras y además vende pescado tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, comercia desde el mercado de la localidad donde vive y se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque todo lo que venden es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además del servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes; Demetrio es un   hombre activo, dedicado a su labor y muy luchador todos los días se esfuerza por tratar de cumplir sus sueños sabe que solo con constancia y amor al trabajo podrá alcanzar ese éxito, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda del producto y quiere recuperarse por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar verdura por mayor y pescado, etc. Demetrio tiene buenas referencias de pago, es muy responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Demetrio lives with his life partner Margarita in their own house. He sells vegetables, tomatoes, chiles, onions, seafood, and other items. The valuable experience he has gained over the years in this business has helped him earn more income. He sells at the local market and has loyal customers who appreciate the good quality, affordable prices, and excellent service he offers. 

Demetrio is active, dedicated to his work, and a fighter. He makes a daily effort to realize his dreams, and he knows that with perseverance and love of your work you can achieve success. Demand has increased in recent weeks. To take advantage of that, he is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan to buy vegetables, seafood, and other items. He has excellent credit references, is responsible, and is certain that he can pay his debt while giving his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and seafood.

loans.name: Elvira Leopoldina

texts.es:
Elvira es una mujer de 39 años, las difíciles circunstancias en su hogar no permitieron que termine de educarse por lo que sólo terminó la escuela primaria. Se casó desde muy joven con José de 33 años quien trabaja como albañil  y tienen  un hijo a quien esperan darle una educación digna y de excelencia.  Viven en Pastaza, un cantón ubicado en la Provincia con el mismo nombre, perteneciente a la Región Amazónica de la República del Ecuador. La cabecera cantonal es la ciudad del Puyo una ciudad ubicada en medio de la selva amazónica al occidente de la provincia de Pastaza y a 924 m. sobre el nivel del mar. Es demográficamente pequeña pero tiene una gran variedad de sitios que son los preferidos para turistas nacionales e internacionales sobre todo los de actividades ecológicas y de deportes extremos. Una ciudad que crece económicamente cada día por las actividades de comercio, ganadería, agricultura y turismo, por lo que en ella se han establecido sucursales de empresas financieras y comerciales que pretenden aprovechar la actividad económica que mantiene esta pequeña ciudad. En cada negocio se encuentra personas que no se han dado por vencidas frente a la falta de empleo sino que han emprendido con sus ideas de negocio para llevar una vida digna y hacer realidad sus sueños.
 Elvira se ha dedicado a los quehaceres de su hogar, pero en vista de la necesidad y de que los gastos cada vez son mayores, decidió desde hace 2 años aportar a la manutención del hogar, por lo cual emprendió en la actividad de crianza de pollos y gallinas para su posterior venta, actividad que aprendió de un pariente quien le capacitó en lo requerido para criaderos, alimentación, aseo, cuidado, etc. Ahora Elvira ha aprendido mucho en su trabajo en el cual invierte desde 8 a 10 horas diarias, alternando con las actividades en su hogar y el cuidado de su hijo. Ella es un ejemplo de esfuerzo y emprendimiento, pues ahora dará el siguiente paso para dar crecimiento a su negocio, ampliando los criaderos y además comprando más pollos, para lo cual solicita un préstamo con el que podrá cumplir esta meta, pues no lo había hecho antes por la falta de capital y por la dificultad y obstáculos para obtenerlo. Ahora acudió a Fundación Alternativa en donde con la intervención de Kiva le han podido brindar agilidad y facilidades para obtener este crédito, por lo cual está agradecida por el apoyo y además por la asesoría personalizada que ha recibido para sacar adelante su negocio y cumplir su objetivo de incrementar sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida y así poder brindar a su hijo la educación que ella no tuvo la oportunidad de tener.
texts.en:
Elvira is a 39-year-old woman. The difficult circumstances of her home did not allow her to complete her education so she only finished primary school. She got married at a very young age to José, 33, who works as a construction worker. They have a child whom they hope to provide with an excellent and worthy education. 

They live in Pastaza, a canton located in the province of the same name belonging to the Amazon region of the Republic of Ecuador. The main city of the canton is Puyo, a city located in the middle of the Amazon jungle to the west of the Pastaza province and at an altitude of 924 meters above sea level. It is demographically small, but it has a great variety of sites preferred by both national and international tourists, especially for their ecological activities and extreme sports. It is a city that grows economically every day through its activities of trade, ranching, farming, and tourism, for which financial and commercial companies have established local branches hoping to make use of the economic activity that this small city maintains. In every business, one can find people who have not given up when confronted with the lack of employment, but rather who have set forth with their ideas of business in order to live worthy lives and accomplish their dreams. 

Elvira has been devoted to the domestic work of her household, but in the view of necessity and daily-increasing expenses, for 2 years now she has decided to contribute to the maintenance of her home. She undertook the raising of chickens and roosters to then later sell, an activity that she learned from a relative who trained her in the requirements of breeding such as the feeding, cleaning, providing care, etc. Presently, Elvria has learned very much about her business, into which she invests 8 to 10 hours daily, alternating with the domestic work of her home and the care of her child. She is an example of effort and endeavor, since now she will take the next step to grow her business by increasing her breeding grounds and buying more chickens. She is applying for this loan so that she will be able to fulfill this goal since she had not done it before because of a lack of funding and the difficulties of obtaining it. Now, she turned to Fundación Alternativa, who--with the participation of Kiva--have offered her more flexibility and ease in obtaining this loan. She is grateful for the support, and also, for the personalized advice that she has received in order to go forward with her business and fulfill her goal of increasing her income in order to improve her quality of life, and in that way, be able to provide her child with the education that she herself did not have the opportunity to attain.

loans.use: to construct larger chicken coops and buy chickens.

loans.name: Anasi

texts.en:
Anasi is a 37-year-old married man with three school-going children, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He operates a retail shop which he started with his savings from teaching, a profession that he still practices. He is honest and hardworking with dreams of owning a wholesale shop despite challenges of inadequate capital and high rental fees. Good father that he is, he desires to educate his children up to the university and build a permanent house for residence.

Anasi intends to use the money to buy general merchandise such as salt and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as salt and soap to sell.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en: Annie  lives in Montserrado County in the capital city of Liberia; it is well known as the commercial city  of Liberia. She 46 years old, married with six children between 17 and 29 years old, that are in school and live at home. For the past three years she has been selling charcoal in her community. She started this business with help from her mother and learned this way of selling from her. She likes her business because it gives her a lot of profit. She is requesting a loan to buy more charcoal  for her business. She wants to get more money to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal  for her business

loans.name: Elvin

texts.en:
Elvin is 23 years old, single, and lives with his parents. He sells food such as macaroni, butter, cookies, sugar, tea, candies and beverages in his shop. Elvin has four years of experience in this field, which makes him a knowledgeable and skilled person.

The food products he sells are very popular and are in high demand. His monthly profit is 130 AZN. He sells products from his shop, which is in the back yard of the house he lives in. His father helps him to run the business and always gives meaningful advice. 

The profit he gains is not enough to reinvest in the business, and meeting customers' demand is difficult for this reason. Elvin would like to increase his sales and invest additional capital. He has applied for a loan of 1000 AZN so he can buy more food to diversify what he sells.

loans.use: to buy more food to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 30 years old and from Gaza. He is married and has two girls. He has owned a place for selling frozen meat and vegetables for one year.

He has asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy refrigerators for the frozen vegetables and meat, and a chicken cleaning machine. He hopes that this loan will help him improve his income

loans.use: to buy refrigerators for the frozen vegetables and meat, and a chicken cleaning machine.

loans.name: Philes

texts.en:
Philes is a 30-year-old married woman. She has four children ranging from 5 to 15 years. She describes herself as a business-oriented and optimistic woman. 

She operates a grocery store and poultry farm where she sells chickens, vegetables and maize. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located within a busy area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as the outbreak of diseases that affect chickens. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy chickens to sell. Her business goal is to own a grocery shop within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more chickens for resale.

loans.name: Viktor

texts.ru:
Виктор 5 лет занимается тепличным хозяйством в своем селе Приветное. На 1.3 гектара земли в теплицах под дугами, акроволокном и на открытом грунте он выращивает укроп, капусту, перец и баклажаны. 
Сумму в 15 000 гривен Виктор намеревается вложить в развитие своего тепличного хозяйства, а именно приобрести семена, пленку для теплиц и удобрения для грунта для нового сельскохозяйственного сезона.
texts.en:
For the past 5 years, Viktor has been a greenhouse farmer in the village of Privetnoye. He grows dill, cabbage, peppers and eggplant on 1.3 hectares of land in small greenhouses, under landscape fabric, and in the open. 

Viktor plans to invest the sum of 15,000 hryvnia into development of his greenhouse farm, namely to purchase seeds, plastic greenhouse cover, and soil fertilizers for the new growing season.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, plastic greenhouse cover and fertilizers for the new growing season

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy beans and maize for resale.

loans.name: Jahangir

texts.en:
Jahangir is a 42-year-old man, married with three children. He repairs carpentery and works in his garage. He has 15 years of experience in this field. He takes orders from his house and makes gates, doors, windows, roofs and other items  from steel.  His monthly income is 170 AZN. His son helps him to take orders and works with Jahangir completing items.

The main challenge in his work is to fill orders on time, and to do this, his working materials are not enough. He applied for 1000 AZN to purchase more steel to take more orders and increase his profit.

loans.use: to buy more working materials to fill more orders

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is 23 years old and comes from Gaza. He owns a place for a local music band for local weddings and parties.

He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy more musical instruments and some furniture for his shop. He hopes that this loan will help him improve his income.

loans.use: to buy more musical instruments and some furniture for his shop

loans.name: Vugar

texts.en:
Vugar is 40 years old. He is married and has two children. Vugar is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fizuli City, who now he lives in the Baku region with his family. 

Vugar has been in the transportation business for five years. Now he needs 1500 AZN to buy spare parts to repair his car for work.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.ru:
Валентина уже 21 год занимается тепличным хозяйством. У нее есть свой участок земли в 1.5 гектара земли, на котором она выращивает помидоры, перец, капусту, лук. Валентина сначала выращивает рассаду в теплицах, а потом, подготовив грунт, высаживает ее на своем участке. 
Валентина необходима сумма в 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить удобрения, пленку, семена, уголь, дрова, а также сделать небольшой ремонт в теплицах и приобрести шланги капельного орошения.
texts.en:
Valentina has been a greenhouse farmer for the past 21 years. She owns 1.5 hectares of land where she grows tomatoes, peppers, cabbage and onions. Valentina begins by growing seedlings in greenhouses and then, having prepared the soil, transplants them into the open air.

Valentina needs a sum of 15,000 hryvnia to buy fertilizers, plastic film, seeds, coal and firewood, as well as perform small repairs in her greenhouses and purchase new hoses for the drip irrigation system.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, plastic film, coal, firewood, and new hoses for the drip irrigation system, as well as perform small repairs in her greenhouses

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en:
Gulnaz is 41 years old, married, and has three children. She is a farmer, raising and selling seasonal fruits and vegetables, which she has been doing for over 10 years. Her monthly income is 120 AZN.

Gulnaz usually sells her crop in the central bazaar.  People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy.  Many national dishes are made of vegetables. Fresh fruits are served at every table in Azerbaijan families.   

Gulnaz is requesting a loan for 2,000 AZN, which she will use to invest in seeds and fertilizers as well as to buy more fruits and vegetables for her shop. This will allow her to improve the quality of products she raises and increase monthly turnover.  Raising crops takes a lot of strength so Gulnaz's son helps her with the farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, fruits, and vegetables for her shop.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.ru:
Владимир 5 лет занимается тепличным хозяйством в своем селе Приветное. На 1.3 гектара земли в теплицах под дугами, акроволокном и на открытом грунте он выращивает укроп, капусту, перец и баклажаны. 
Сумму в 10 000 гривен Владимир намеревается вложить в развитие своего тепличного хозяйства, а именно приобрести семена, пленку для теплиц и удобрения для грунта для нового сельскохозяйственного сезона.
texts.en:
Vladimir has been a greenhouse farmer in the village of Privetnoye for the past 5 years. He cultivates dill, cabbage, peppers and eggplant on 1.3 hectares of land in small greenhouses, under landscape fabric, as well as out in the open.

Vladimir plans to invest the sum of 10,000 hryvnia into development of his business by buying seeds, plastic greenhouse cover, and soil fertilizers in time for the new growing season.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, plastic greenhouse covering, and soil fertilizers for the new growing season

loans.name: Taleh

texts.en:
Taleh is a 27-year-old man, married with two children.  He sells fruits such as pears, oranges, apples, pomegranates and bananas. Taleh has six years of experience in this field and has gained the necessary skills and knowledge required for his business. 

Fruit is very popular among Azerbaijan people and in high demand during the year.  People like to eat it fresh and this is one of the main desserts for guests. His shop is located in the center bazaar and people always pass his shop and come to buy fresh fruit. His monthly income from this business is 130 AZN.  Taleh`s wife helps him to sell fruit.

Taleh wants to expand his business. The amount of produce he sells is not enough to cover high demand. He would like to purchase more fruits and vegetables and increase his turnover as well as improve the life of his family. For this purpose he applied for a 1500 AZN loan.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is 56 years old and married. She lives in the small village of Gurjaani district, East Georgia. The family runs an agricultural business. They have four pigs and sell meat locally in an open market. They also have three hectares of agricultural land, where sunflowers are grown. 

Tamar has a grocery store in her village. She is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase stock for the shop. With the additional stock, her sales will increase as will the income of the family, which enable them to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 20 years old and comes from Gaza. He has owned a food stall in the vegetable market since 2011. He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a small automobile to reduce transportation costs.

Mohammad hopes that this loan will help him reduce costs and increase his income through cutting transportation costs.

loans.use: to buy a small automobile

loans.name: Amrah

texts.en:
Amrah is a 39-year-old man, married with two children.  He sells food products as macaroni, rice, candies, cookies, sugar and beverages in his shop.  Amrah has six years of experience in this field, which makes him a knowledgeable and skilled person.

The food products he sells are very popular with people and are in high demand. His monthly profit from selling foods is 170 AZN. His wife and son help him to sell products in their shop. He is a very successful entrepreneur because of good location, in a central bazaar of his home town.

Amrah would like to increase his sales and invest additional capital. For this purpose he applied for a loan of 1000 AZN. He will purchase diverse additional foodstuffs.  This will be his second loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy  additional food  products and diversify his inventory

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa lives near one of the most populated and best-known markets in Montserrado county. She is 29 years old and has four children ages 2, 4, 7, and 10. Three of them are in school and they all live at home. For the past three years she has been selling rice, peppers, palm oil, and other items on a table. One of the problems she faces is the rainy season.  She enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit she makes. Being busy makes her proud of her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, peppers, palm oil, and other items for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, peppers, palm oil, and other items for her business

loans.name: Erustus

texts.en:
Erustus is 31 years old, married, and has one child. His spouse assists him in meeting some of their financial needs. Erustus runs a small scale farming business, which he has been doing for three years. He earns an verage income of  6,000 KES a month. 

Erustus is requesting his second loan for 11,000 KES, which he will use to purchase farm inputs in preparation for the next planting season.  With the anticipated profits, he intends to expand his business by starting a dairy farming business to diversify his sources of income, and pay school fees for his child. His future plan is to buy a plot in Kabarnet town to enable him to built rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs in preparation for the next planting season.

loans.name: Majed

texts.en:
Majed is 40 years old and is from Gaza. He is married and has six children. He has owned a small grocery store since 2008.

He asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy a refrigerator and more goods. He hopes that this loan will help him improve his income and thus provide his children with a better life.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and more goods

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raúl de cuarenta y dos años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia, él se dedica a la venta de verduras, tiene varios años de experiencia en el negocio y eso le ha dado la oportunidad de obtener siempre las mejores ganancias, su puesto esta ubicada en un lugar que califico como bueno para su trabajo ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas lo prefieren porque vende las verduras mas frescas, además tiene los mejores precios, y el servicio mas rápido; Raúl es un hombre entregado a su labor, dispuesta a dar todo de su parte para cumplir sus sueños lo mas impórtate en su vida es su familia y en las ultimas semanas el deterioro de su vivienda ha incomodado la tranquilidad de su hogar, la casa necesita reparaciones y quiere realizarlas lo mas pronto posible para la seguridad en su hogar, su mas grande secreto es la perseverancia, sabe que así alcanzara el éxito, necesita invertir pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cemento, ladrillos, madera, herramientas etc. Raúl tiene buenas referencias de pago y se hace responsable de cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Raúl, who is 42 years old, lives with his life partner and their children in their own home. He makes a living selling vegetables. He has several years of experience in this business; his experience has helped him to achieve a higher profit margin. His sales stand is in a good location that is a good fit for the business. He has a good customer base, because people prefer to buy from him because he sells the freshest vegetables at the best prices and also provides the fastest service.    

Raúl is a man who is very devoted to his work, willing to give everything he has to be able to reach his goals. The most important thing to him in life is his family. In the last few weeks the deterioration of the house has taken the peace out of their home atmosphere. The house needs repairs and he wants to do them as soon as possible, to insure the safety of his home. His greatest secret is perseverance, he knows that this is the key to success. He needs to invest in home repairs, but does not have sufficient capital to do so. This is why he has requested a loan through INTEGRAL. The loan he has requested will allow him to buy cement, bricks, wood, tools, etc.  Raúl has a good credit history and takes full responsibility for paying the loan back. He has faith that he will be able to provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, wood and tools.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 43 years old and has four children.  She lives in West Point, Montserrado County, which is noted to be the most commercial city in Liberia. Victoria is a high school graduate and is good at understanding business. 

For the past six years, Victoria has been selling bread and eggs in the local market on a table. She spends eight hours a day at her business. She enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit she makes.  

One of the problems Victoria faces is the lack of capital so she is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more bread and eggs to sell. Her dream is to become a big business woman and  build a house.

loans.use: to purchase bread and eggs for her business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan  is a married woman. She has six children. She describes herself to be a patient and honest woman. She operates a retail store where she sells daily-use products such as salt, sugar, tea leaves, etc. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located within a public area  and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy daily-use products to sell. Her business goal is to improve her business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy daily-use items to sell

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 32 years old and comes from Nyandarua South. He is married with two children who are aged seven and three years old.

Charles is a farmer and has been in this business for the past 13 years. He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy more dairy cows for his farm.

He hopes to expand his dairy farming and be able to increase his milk sales.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Tunzala

texts.en: This is Tunzala's third loan. She is very thankful to Kiva and Kiva lenders for helping her in every loan. Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy some thermal batteries for the place where she teaches the children, because in winter they are very cold. Tunzala has been in this education business for seven years.

loans.use: to buy some thermal batteries for her school room

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydiah is quite happy about the progress her business has made. Prior to the festive season, she made great sales which enabled her to complete the repayments on time. She is applying for a loan of Ksh 85,900 Kenya shillings to increase the amount of stock in her business buying sugar, wheat and maize flour, and cereals, etc. 

Lydiah looks forward to improving her business because she believes it is her only source of livelihood and can help pay the school fee requirements of her children. She still harbors the ambition of growing it to a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy sugar, wheat and maize flour, and cereals.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 10 years to 24 years. She describes herself as a dynamic woman. 

She operates a farm and a retail business where she sells rice, maize etc. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located within a busy residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances for improving her business. 

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy rice to sell. Her business goal is to be a major distributor of rice within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy rice to sell.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is glad about being a Milango client. He obtained a good harvest from the business. He is applying for a loan to start preparing the farm for the coming season. 

A loan of 10,650 KES will help him pay for farm preparation, seeds, and fertilizers. He also looks forward to increasing the acreage of his fruit farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers and prepare his farm.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en: Chizi is requesting a loan for 21,050 KES, which she will use to prepare her farm and buy seeds and fertilizers. She intends to save the additional income for future projects. Her main ambition is to increase her acreage, which she believes will help her pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: to hire labor for the cultivation of her farm and pay for seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria lives in West Point, one of the most populated and best-known areas in Montserrado county. She is 36 years old and has two children aged 12 and 19. She is a high school graduate and has business management skills naturally, but she also serves her county as a police officer. She and her daughter have been running her used clothes business for three years in her community on a table. She spends seven hours a day with her business since she has to wait for her daughter to come from school before she goes to work. She really enjoys the interaction with her customers, and the profit she receives from her business makes her proud. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her dream is to become a big businesswoman  and  build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 24 year old married man. He describes himself as a cooperative and caring man. 

He operates a motorcycle business where he provides transportation services. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located within an urban area and his primary customers are business people from the town. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high prices of fuel. 

This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the 20,000 KES loan, along with additional savings he has, to buy another motorcycle. 

His business goal is to buy a car to increase his transportation services within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for his business.

loans.name: Pekwe

texts.en:
Pekwe is grateful for the first loan she received. It was used to cultivate the farm and plant crops. The harvest was a source of food for the family besides earning them an income to pay off the loan.

Her ambition is to farm a larger piece of land. She is therefore applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to pay for the farm cultivation, seeds and fertilizers. She also looks forward to increasing the size of her flock from the additional income.

loans.use: to cultivate the land and pay for seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Haron Group

texts.en:
Haron is a group consisting of four women who live in Taiz, Yemen. They are requesting a loan from AMB for 80,000 YER.

Ala is 22 years old, married, and has children. She likes to watch television on every subject such as social, adventure, and educational news. Ala is requesting a youth loan for 20,000 YER, which she will use to buy television to use in her house. .

loans.use: to purchase a television.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is happy being a Milango client. She had a previous loan of 10,650 Kes which helped her buy seeds and bags for planting. She is now applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to prepare the farm and buy seeds and fertilizers. She intends to save the additional income for future projects and her main ambition is to increase the acreage. 

The lending group which she joined is called “adui ni njaa”; translated as 'hunger is the enemy'. All are farmers and are working hard towards food security.

loans.use: To pay for the cultivation of the farm and buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Caleb

texts.en:
Caleb is 27 years old, from Nyandarua South and is married, with one child who is in school. He has a workshop where he makes seats and tables and has been doing it for the past ten years. 

Caleb has applied for his third loan from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) to enable him buy more timber to add to his workshop. He hopes to expand his business and open another workshop in a neighboring town.

loans.use: to buy more timber to use in his workshop.

loans.name: Amiran

texts.en:
Amiran is 63 years old. He lives in the small village of Baghdati district, with his wife and son. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have six milk cows and a pig. In addition, they have a vineyard with 1,500 samples of wine. Amiran owns a tractor and serves local people, cultivating the land. He is a very hard-working man and has a rich experience in his business. 

Amiran requested a loan to repair his tractor since it is old and has been out of order for a couple of months. After some parts are changed, it will be ready for spring seasonal, agricultural work. Amiran will still be able to use his tractor for income generation. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to repair his tractor.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es: Benita, tiene 49 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos, vive en el municipio de potrerillos, cortes. Benita anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de tortillas y hace 7 años inicio vendiendo ropa. Vende camisas pantalones y calcetas. ademas vende calzado tambien por pedidos. El negocio lo realiza en su casa y tiene su clientela establecida. El prestamo que ha solicitado es por 4,500 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de ropa como camisas y pantalones para mantener surtido su negocio. El objetivo es hacer crecer el negocio y el número de clientes, ya que su meta es tener un  puesto de venta en el  mercado de la comunidad cercana y en un futuro quiere dejarlo como un patrimonio para sus hijos. Agradece mucho a ODEF y a Kiva por confiar en ella.
texts.en:
Benita is 49 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in the town of Potrerillos, Cortes.

Benita previously sold tortillas, but seven years ago she started selling clothes. She sells shirts, trousers, and socks. In addition, she sells shoes upon request. Benita operates her business out of her home and has an established clientele.

The loan she is requesting is in the amount of 4,500 HNL and will be invested in the purchase of clothing, such as shirts and trousers, so that she can maintain the inventory of her business. Her objective is to grow her business and increase the number of customers. She also has a goal of opening a vending stall at the market in the community nearby so that she can leave an inheritance for her children in the future. Benita is very grateful to ODEF and Kiva for trusting her.

loans.use: to buy shirts and trousers to sell.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen lives in Ninotsminda District. He is 29 years old and lives with his wife, infant daughter and parents. 

Karen is, at the moment, unemployed. The only source of income for the family is growing potatoes which they sell seasonally. 

The family lives in poverty. According to Credo estimations, they belong to the 'vulnerable poor' category. 

Karen decided to start a business because their existing income isn’t enough for the family and their living conditions are poor. 

His loan request was approved as part of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan programme aims to provide business start-up and re-startup loans with more favourable conditions to the rural poor, who do not have access to standard credit, being regarded as 'high-risk borrowers' because of their low income. 

With this loan, Karen will purchase a car and offer a service to local people as a taxi driver. The income of the family will increase and they will be able to improve their living conditions. The family will also have enough income to use the usual sources of credit in the country, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase a car to use as a taxi.

loans.name: Hassani

texts.en:
Hassani is happy about the income he obtained from the sale of trees on his farm. Though the income is not from the actual trees planted from the loan, he can now carry out farming with much confidence with no fear of where to source seedlings and fertilizers.
The lending group which he joined is called “adui ni njaa”; translated as hunger is the enemy. All are farmers and are working hard towards food security. He is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to plant more trees and also farm food crops (i.e. paying for cultivation, and buying seeds and fertilizers.)

loans.use: To pay for cultivation and purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Maria Alejandra

texts.es:
La señora Maria Alejandra esta casada, tiene 39 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, se dedica al comercio a la atención a una tienda en general, lleva 3 años de experiencia, tiene 1 hijo pequeño, actualmente esta en construcción de su vivienda, dando una mejor forma de vida a su familia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien la apoya económicamente.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para a compra de materiales para su vivienda, entre los cuales  son cemento, arena, cal, y entre otros, espera mejorar su vivienda, y también su negocio, espera en el futuro tener una tienda mas grande en su casa, para atender mejor a los que tiene clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Alejandra is 39 years old, married, and did not have the opportunity to study. She works in the retail trade by managing her own general store. She has three years of experience and takes care of a young son. Maria Alejandra is currently building a home so that she can provide a better life for her family. She receives assistance from her husband who also provides financial support.

Maria Alejandra is requesting a loan in order to buy construction materials for her home, such as cement, sand, lime powder, and other items. She hopes this will result in improvements to her household, as well as her business. In the future, she hopes to have a much larger store in her house so that she can provide better service to her existing customers.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for building her home.

loans.name: Beja

texts.en:
Beja is preparing his farm for this season's planting. He is applying for a loan of 21050 Kenya shillings to prepare the farm and buy seeds and fertilizers. He intends to save the additional income for future projects and his main ambition is to improve on the fruit farm. This, he believes, will help him pay for his children’s education.
The lending group which he joined is called “adui ni njaa”; translated as hunger is the enemy. All are farmers and are working hard towards food security.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Engy

texts.en:
Engy is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo. 

Engy is a married woman from Jabalia. She lives in a small house with her husband and seven children -- three sons and four daughters. Engy's husband is an employee with a very low salary. This salary barely covers the necessary family needs. 

Engy would like to improve her house's condition by buying new living room furniture. Engy took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). Taking this loan will offer to Engy and her family comfortable furniture, so they can enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: To buy new living room furniture.

loans.name: Alaaedden

texts.en:
AlaaEdden is a 29-year-old married man and father to two sons. For the past two years, AlaaEdden has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and is the only source of income for his family, but he also needs some support to cover costs. The taxi he drives needs repairs such as installing new wheels and repainting. 

AlaaEdden took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to repair his taxi and increase the family income. 

About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to pay some of the maintenance and repair costs for his taxi.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es una persona feliz, muy dedicada a su trabajo, responsable para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Martha vive en la ciudad de Atuntaqui con su esposo y sus tres hijos. Martha se dedica a confeccionar prendas de vestir, este negocio lo heredó de su madre, al momento le está yendo muy bien ya que sus productos los está distribuyendo a algunas tiendas de ropa en su ciudad.
Martha solicita un crédito a FODEMI para invertir en la compra de tela térmica y tela de algodón en cantidad mayores para la realización de sus prendas de vestir al por mayor, inversión que le permitirá incrementar sus ventas e ingresos. 
Martha sueña en tener un taller más grande que le permita contratar a más personal y convertirse en una empresa grande y distribuir al por mayor en todo el país y con estos ingresos darles la educación a sus hijos y enseñarles este bonito oficio para que sigan con la tradición.
texts.en:
Martha is a cheerful person who is very dedicated to her work and responsible for trying to improve her family's quality of life. Martha lives in the city of Atuntaqui with her husband and her three children. She works making clothes, having inherited this business from her mother. At the moment things are going well for her as she is distributing her products to some clothes shops in the city. 
Martha is requesting a loan from FODEMI to invest in buying thermal and cotton fabric in large quantities so that she can produce her clothes wholesale. This investment will allow her to increase her sales and her income. 
Martha dreams of having a larger workshop which will allow her to hire more workers and to become a large company, distributing wholesale all over the country, and using this income to give her children an education and to teach them this nice profession so that they continue the tradition.

loans.use: to buy cotton and thermal fabric to make clothes.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a married man. He has 6 children ranging in age from 15 years to 28 years. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a grocery store  and a farm where he sells vegetables such as maize, beans, cabbage, kale etc . He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located within an urban area and his primary customers are schools, institutions and hotels . He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy vegetables and fruits to sell . His business goal is to be a large supplier of fruit and vegetables within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruit to sell

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 51 years old and a single mother to three children. She is a farmer in Nyahururu town, where she grows cash crops such as maize, beans and potatoes. She has been in the business for more than 10 years and it has been profitable.

This is her second loan and she plans to use it to buy supplies for the farm, such as seeds, fertilizer and manure.

Gladys anticipates making greater profits from her harvest, which she will use to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to grow her business and farm on a larger scale, making more income and thus be able to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as fertilizer, seeds and manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chairs, scissors, and other barbershop materials.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a married man. He has 5 children with ranging in age from 7 to 25 years old. He describes himself to be a determined man . He operates a farm where he sells potatoes . He has been involved in this business for 18 years. His business is located within a viable business area and his primary customers are schools, institutions and hotels . He describes his biggest business challenge to be harsh climatic conditions which affect the crop . He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy seed potatoes . His business goal is to grow his business within the next 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy seed potatoes

loans.name: Sana

texts.en:
Sana is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother to three sons and three daughters. Her husband is employed with a low wage which is not enough to cover all the family's needs. 

For the past year, Sana has been operating a kindergarten. She has a good reputation among her clients, which makes her project a successful and profitable one. It is a second helper source of income to the family. Sana would like to expand the kindergarten by adding additional rooms to raise the income. 

Sana took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help Sana to make some improvements for her project and increase the revenue. 

Sana is pictured inside her kindergarten.

loans.use: to pay the costs of expanding the kindergarten.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man. He describes himself to be a hardworking man. 

John operates a retail business where he sells paraffin and diesel. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located within a busy area, and his primary customers are motor vehicle owners and residents from the environs. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. John will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy paraffin and diesel to sell. 

John's business goal is to run a petrol filling station within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a large-scale filling station.

loans.use: to buy paraffin and diesel.

loans.name: Kefah

texts.en:
Kefah is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Kefah is a 30-year-old, Palestinian, married woman. She lives with her husband and four young children in Qalqilia. Kefah's husband is a construction employee with a low salary, which is not enough to cover all the family's needs. 

Kefah and her husband are trying to improve the quality of living for the family and, because of that, they built a new house. Their house still needs some construction materials to be ready, such as cement and iron.

Kefah took a USD Youth loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help Kefah's family to complete their house faster, so they can enjoy living in their house soon.

loans.use: to pay the construction expenses to complete the family home.

loans.name: Saadi

texts.en:
Saadi is 19 years old and is from Gaza. He has owned a small vegetable stall in the vegetable market since January 2012.

Saadi asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a small automobile to cut transportation costs for his business. He hopes that this loan, by helping him reduce transportation costs, will in turn improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a small automobile to cut transportation costs.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 40 years old and is from Ndunyu Njeru. She is married with five children, who are between the ages of one and twenty-two years old.

Agnes has a farming business that she has been doing for 20 years. She has applied for her fourth loan from KADET LTD to enable her buy fertilizers, a cupboard and to pay school fees for her children. 

She hopes to boost her business and educate her children to university level.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay school fees

loans.name: Nowwara

texts.en:
Nowwara is 30 years old and comes from Gaza. She is married and lives with her eight family members at her father-in-law's house.

She owns a small shop for tailoring clothes for kids and selling them. She asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy new tailoring and sewing machines.

She hopes that this loan will help her start with a display space and increase her income through selling more clothes in order to provide her children with a better education.

loans.use: to buy new tailoring and sewing machines

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself as a focused and determined man. 

Evans operates a barber shop where he provides haircut services. His business is located within a busy business environment and his primary customers are men. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Evans will use the KES 19,500 loan to buy a solar lamp which will be used by his six family members for lighting. His business goal is to expand his business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved his business.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel

loans.name: Aydah

texts.en:
Aydah is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Aydah is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother to two sons and three daughters. Her husband is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover all the family's needs.

Aydah and her husband own a taxi office.  They have had this business for four years. It is considered a very successful business because it is located in a very crowded area in Jabalia.  Aydah and her husband are very ambitious; they want to improve their project by buying office furniture and some communication devices to make the job more efficient. 

Aydah took out a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help Aydah and her husband to buy furniture and some communication devices for the taxi office. This will help to improve the project and increase the family's income.

About Shariah-compliant lending:

FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To pay for furniture and communication devices for the taxi office

loans.name: Pedro Ángel

texts.es:
Don Pedro tiene 61 años de edad, es casado y tiene cinco hijos. Él vive muy humildemente, es muy reconocido en el lugar en donde vive por ser un hombre trabajador. Se dedica a la agricultura, desde muy temprana edad, no se le presento la oportunidad de estudiar; debido a que en ese tiempo los padres no se preocupaban por eso; sino más bien por que trabajaran; pero él nos comenta que se siente muy feliz por haber aprendido a trabajar.

Para comprar los insumos agrícolas, don Pedro debe viajar en su mula unos 1000 metros desde su casa hasta el lugar en donde espera un vehiculo, para llegar a la ciudad, debido a que el lugar en donde vive es de difícil acceso.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar los materiales para construir una casa de adobe y pago de mano de obra. Dicha casa será para el hijo, o para él según quede ya terminada. Su deseo, es que su hijo tenga un lugar digno en donde pueda vivir y con los servicios básicos, como: agua potable y energía eléctrica, la cual será construida con sus propias manos. Además, desea continuar trabajando en la agricultura fuertemente para bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is 61 years old and is married with five children. He lives very humbly and he is very well-known in the place where he lives for being a hard-working man. He has worked in agriculture from a very young age as he wasn't given the opportunity to study because at that time his parents were more concerned about working. However, he tells us that he is happy that he learnt to work.

In order to buy agricultural supplies, Pedro must travel with his mule some 1000 metres from his house to the place where a vehicle waits for him to travel to the city, as the place where he lives is difficult to access.

The loan which he is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy material to build a house from adobe and to pay workers. This house will be for his son, or for him depending on how it turns out. His wish is for his son to have a decent place to live with basic amenities such as drinking water and electricity, which will be constructed with his own hands. Besides, he wants to continue working hard in agriculture for the wellbeing of his family.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a house from adobe and to pay workers.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a man of 68 years, married to Serah and a father of five children. He operates a retail shop and also has rental houses. He has been in this business for eight years now.

This will be Joseph's sixth loan with KADET LTD, he plans to use this loan to add stock to his retail business by buying rice, sugar, maize flour etc., and also to renovate his rental houses. In the future he wants to own property.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, cooking oil for resale and to renovate his rental houses

loans.name: Blanca Esmeralda

texts.es: Doña Blanca tiene 55 años de edad, esta casada, tiene un hijo y vive en la Esperanza Intibucá junto a su esposo y su hijo. Doña Blanca hace dos años decidió establecer su propio negocio de una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar, como ser: azúcar, arroz, frijoles, pan, refrescos, manteca, churros, condimentos, pollo, café y otros. Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio anteriormente vendía comidas. Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo a ODEF por 11,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar un frezer o congelador de segunda mano para vender embutidos. Esta inversión le ayudara a poder vender embutidos en la pulpería. Su plan es reinvertir las ganancias para hacer crecer el negocio.
texts.en:
Blanca is 55 years old, married, and has a son. She lives in La Esperanza Intibucá with her husband and son. Two years ago, Blanca decided to set up her own business, a small general store, where she sells basic household necessities such as sugar, rice, beans, bread, soft drinks, lard, snacks condiments, chicken, coffee, and other items.

She has always had a business; previously she sold meals. She is requesting a second loan from ODEF, for 11,000 lempiras, with which she is going to  buy a second-hand freezer so that she can sell cold cuts. 

This investment will help her to sell cold cuts in the general store. Her plan is to reinvest the earnings to make her business grow.

loans.use: To buy a freezers so that she can sell cold cuts.

loans.name: Abizera Group

texts.fr:
Acqueline fait partie du groupe Abizera et   habite à Gitega. Elle a   35 ans et est mariée à Deo, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont  4 enfants, âgés de 3  à 11 ans, tous  étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de boutique (riz, haricot, huile de palme,…)  depuis 3 ans. 

Elle est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’articles de sa boutique (riz, haricot, huile de palme ,…)   à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Avec le gain de son commerce, elle satisfait les besoins essentiels de sa famille (se nourrir, se loger, se vêtir, payer les frais scolaires des enfants).
texts.en:
Acqueline belongs to the Abizera group and lives in Gitega.  She is 35 years old and married to Deo, a business man.  Together they have four children between the ages of 3 and 11.  They all attend school.  

She has a shop where she has been running a business of selling rice, beans, palm oil, etc. for three years.  

She is on her third loan with Turame.  With the KIVA loan that she is getting, she will increase her working capital and buy numerous items for her shop such as rice, beans, and palm oil, which will increase her profits.  

With the profit from her business, she can meet the major needs of her family such as food, shelter, clothing, and educational expenses.

loans.use: to increase her capital in order to buy items for her store such as rice, beans and oil, which will increase her profits. .

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 50 years old and is married, with two children, aged 2 and 13. He is a farmer and has been doing it for the last 35 years. 

Patrick has applied for his fifth loan from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) to enable him to buy fertilizer and seedlings. He hopes to be the leading farmer in his area, in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fertlizer and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Lawi

texts.en:
Lawi lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has six school going children. He owns a clothing shop, a business that he has been operating for fifteen years. He started the business through his personal savings. He is also a building contractor.
He learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are occasional limited demand and high market fees.
Lawi is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenyan shillings to buy more clothes to sell. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Cleotilde

texts.es:
Don Cleotilde tiene 61 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Se dedica a la agricultura, desde muy temprana edad, tiene una gran experiencia en lo que hace y motivación. Aprendió junto con su papá; debido a que en ese tiempo lo que más anhelaban los padres es que sus hijos aprendieran a trabajar, por ese motivo no estudio. 

Para comprar los insumos agrícolas, viaja a la ciudad que esta a hora y media en vehiculo particular o autobús; pero por no circular transporte hasta donde él vive debe pagar otro vehiculo para trasladar los insumos hasta su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para reparar el molino para picar zacate, esta dañado el motor y necesita repararlo ya que es en esta época que trabaja como molinero prestando sus servicios a las personas que lo contratan. Así, recibirá un ingreso extra para sostenimiento de su familia; pues manifiesta que en este tiempo esta difícil el dinero y por ello debe limitarse de muchas cosas. 

Su mayor deseo, es proporcionar a su familia de lo que él no pudo obtener cuando joven; como lo fue el estudio y otras cosas para mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
Don Cleotilde is a 61-year old man, married and father of two children. He works on agriculture since he was very young, and has a great experience and motivation in what he does. He learned with his father and didn't study, as at that time what parents wanted was for their children to learn a job. In order to buy farming inputs, he needs to go to the city, which is one and a half hour away by car or bus. Also, given that there's not direct transportation to where he lives, he needs to use another vehicle to take home all those inputs.  

He will use the loan requested to Fundación Campo to repair the mill to cut up forage. The engine is damaged and he needs to repair it so that he can continue to work as a miller providing services to people who hire him. Thanks to this, he will receive an extra income to support his family, especially at a time when money is difficult to earn and they need to make a lot of sacrifices. His biggest dream is to provide his family with what he couldn't enjoy when he was young: the possibility of studying and other things to improve their lives.

loans.use: to repair the mill to cut up forage.

loans.name: Susana Filomena

texts.es: Susana, 61 años de edad, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta y elaboración  de hamburguesas y  hot dog, madre de 5 hijos, es originaria del Municipio de  San Carlos, pero actualmente vive en Granada, lleva 2 años trabajando en el sector comercio. Ella inicio  con su pequeño negocio, vendiendo hot-dog de forma ambulante, asi es como ella  se gana la vida, y ha podido salir adelante con las ganancias que le genera su negocio de hamburguesa, cuenta con el apoyo de su hija y el de su hermano. Sus expectativas es hacer crecer su negocio. Ella esta requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar un barril y toda la materia prima que necesita como, leña, tomate, cebolla, harina, etc. ya que ella estima que este préstamo le ayudaría a comprar todo lo necesario para la elaboración de su comida, sus planes futuros es tener un negocio estable y rentable con muy buena clientela.
texts.en:
Susana, age 61, is a merchant who prepares and sells hamburgers and hot dogs. She is the mother of five children and is originally from the town of San Carlos, but currently lives in Granada. Susana has been working for two years in the retail trade. She started her small business by selling hot dogs as a street vendor so that she could earn a living. Susana was then able to move forward with the earnings she generated from selling hamburgers. She has the support of her daughter and her brother. Her expectations include being able to grow her business.

Susana is in need of a loan so that she can buy a barrel and all of the supplies that she needs such as firewood, tomatoes, onions, flour, and other items. She feels that this loan will help her buy all the things that she needs to prepare her food. Her future plans include having a stable and profitable business with very good customers.

loans.use: to buy a barrel, firewood, tomatoes, onions, flour, and other items.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as a determined and honest woman. She operates a grocery store,  where she sells vegetables and fruits. Her business is located within a busy shopping centre, and her primary customers are residents from the environs. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business.  Her business goal is to improve her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her grocery store business.  In addition, Alice sells clothes that are commonly known as 'Mitumba' in local language, which increases her business income. 

She will use the KES 29,860 loan to buy bathroom tiles so as to improve her bathroom condition.

loans.use: to buy bathroom tiles.

loans.name: Sonia Bertalina

texts.es: Sonia Bertalina de cuarenta y cinco años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta  de antojitos típicos,  atol, empanadas, pastelitos, pupusas, entre otros tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, comercia en el lugar que califico como muy bueno para sus actividades comerciales ya tiene mucha clientela fija que la prefiere porque todo lo que vende es de primera calidad, a precios accesibles pero sobre todo con un excelente servicio; Sonia es una mujer emprendedora, con muchas ganas de salir adelante siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar el éxito que tanto desea, como toda buena comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero para ello necesita de capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un credito que le permita comprar verduras, maíz, carnes, quesillo, etc. Sonia Bertalina tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la confianza que le dara a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sonia Bertalina, age 45, lives in her own house with her life partner and their children.  She sells typical snacks, ‘atol’ [corn-based beverage], empanadas, pastries, and ‘pupusas’ [stuffed corn tortillas], among others.

She has had the business for several years, and this has rewarded her with a lot of sales experience.  This allows her to get better income.  She does business in a place that is very good for commercial activities.  She has a lot of fixed customers who prefer her.  This is because everything she sells is first quality at reasonable prices and because, most of all, she provides excellent service.  

Sonia is an enterprising woman with a great desire to get ahead.  She is always on the lookout for new opportunities that will allow her to achieve the success she so desires.
